commit_message:
Add spec on implementing oslo.policy

Presently, neither monasca-api nor monasca-log-api use oslo.policy. Instead,
they contain their own policy enforcement code. Without oslo.policy they will
not be able to implement the policy in code community goal for Queens, which
requires the use of oslo mechanisms for defining and enforcing policy. This
spec gives a roadmap for switching monasca-{api,log-api} to using oslo.policy.

Change-Id: Icf9ec728a20ff38cfe29c72acae2df5f4383f0f6
Story: 2001233
Task: 5749

[{'created': '2018-01-08 07:51:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix VF-rep lookup routine to use parent PF number

The current logic in get_representor_port() matches the VF number with
the one in 'phys_port_name' file. If and when multiple PFs on the same
card are configured in switchdev mode, we could end up returning a wrong
representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' format is used in 'phys_port_name' file.

Change-Id: I5727878b63026a19fafcf7e71dda3ba480432fbf
Signed-off-by: Sriharsha Basavapatna <sriharsha.basavapatna@broadcom.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-01-09 05:08:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix VF-rep lookup routine to use parent PF number

card are configured in switchdev mode, we could end up returning a wrong
representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' format is used in 'phys_port_name' file.

Change-Id: I5727878b63026a19fafcf7e71dda3ba480432fbf
Signed-off-by: Sriharsha Basavapatna <sriharsha.basavapatna@broadcom.com>

the one in 'phys_port_name' file. If and when multiple PFs on the same

representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' (or vfY@pfX) format is used in 'phys_port_name'
file.

This patch also provides corresponding changes in unit tests. The tests
have been updated to validate 'phys_port_name' in 'pfXvfY' format (in
addition to the simple format - vfX or X). The test case for 2 PFs
specifically utilizes the 'pfXvfY' format, since otherwise it won't
be possible to disambiguate VFs with the same VF-ID under 2 PFs on the
same card (switch).

commit_message:
Fix VF-rep lookup routine to use parent PF number

The current logic in get_representor_port() matches the VF number with
the one in 'phys_port_name' file. If and when multiple PFs on the same
card are configured in switchdev mode, we could end up returning a wrong
representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' (or vfY@pfX) format is used in 'phys_port_name'
file.

This patch also provides corresponding changes in unit tests. The tests
have been updated to validate 'phys_port_name' in 'pfXvfY' format (in
addition to the simple format - vfX or X). The test case for 2 PFs
specifically utilizes the 'pfXvfY' format, since otherwise it won't
be possible to disambiguate VFs with the same VF-ID under 2 PFs on the
same card (switch).

Change-Id: I5727878b63026a19fafcf7e71dda3ba480432fbf
Closes-Bug: #1743494
Signed-off-by: Sriharsha Basavapatna <sriharsha.basavapatna@broadcom.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 13:30:46.000000000', 'message': "Fixes incorrect ownership of ODL TLS cert/key

Deployments were failing because the owner/group of the TLS generated
certificate and key were set to 'odl'.  This user and group does not
exist in a containerized deployment because the ODL RPM is only
installed in the container.

This patch leaves the owner as root for the files which works because
the files are only used to generate a keystore for ODL (which is owned
by odl), and the cert/key files themselves are never read by ODL.

Closes-Bug: 1757135

Change-Id: Ie5b9e98ea2fc16b820d56272653df4874e81cf68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-03-20 16:47:13.000000000', 'message': "Fixes incorrect ownership of ODL TLS cert/key

Deployments were failing because the owner/group of the TLS generated
certificate and key were set to 'odl'.  This user and group does not
exist in a containerized deployment because the ODL RPM is only
installed in the container.

This patch leaves the owner as root for the files which works because
the files are only used to generate a keystore for ODL (which is owned
by odl), and the cert/key files themselves are never read by ODL.

Closes-Bug: 1757135

Change-Id: Ie5b9e98ea2fc16b820d56272653df4874e81cf68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes incorrect ownership of ODL TLS cert/key

Deployments were failing because the owner/group of the TLS generated
certificate and key were set to 'odl'.  This user and group does not
exist in a containerized deployment because the ODL RPM is only
installed in the container.

This patch leaves the owner as root for the files which works because
the files are only used to generate a keystore for ODL (which is owned
by odl), and the cert/key files themselves are never read by ODL.

Closes-Bug: 1757135

Change-Id: Ie5b9e98ea2fc16b820d56272653df4874e81cf68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
track config file and command line locations for user settings

Keep track of which configuration file a group of settings is in to
try to report that as a detail for user settings.

Track settings from the command line separately from settings in the
configuration files.

It is possible that the configuration file details can be wrong if a
group appears in more than one file. We can be more accurate with this
after we have the backend driver feature implemented, but since most
deployments use a single file so this should be relatively useful.

Change-Id: I04ce72dbc5f676296acfeafc13169177ad815350
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

thanks, eric'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-12 23:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

At this point I'm going to abstain until Stephen and Kong have had their concerns addressed."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-03-14 01:06:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> At this point I'm going to abstain until Stephen and Kong have had
 > their concerns addressed.

eric, could you please remind me in which irc channel i should ask for the naming suggestion?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-14 13:40:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good question.  #openstack-dev?  Perhaps more effective would be to add some key folks to this review, which I've done.

Monty, Chris, Colleen - suggestions here?  Thanks."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-14 14:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Good question.  #openstack-dev?  Perhaps more effective would be to
 > add some key folks to this review, which I've done.
 > 
 > Monty, Chris, Colleen - suggestions here?  Thanks.

#openstack-sdks is where this stuff could/should be discussed, but yeah here is just as good.

The entry for 'service_type' should be what shows up in the service type of the keystone service catalog. It looks like in the qinling devstack plugin this is 'function-engine' (currently given as an alias).

The README for service-type-authority has guidance on choosing names: https://github.com/openstack/service-types-authority#naming

but the general rule has been that if there is an existing name that is widely deployed it probably makes sense for that to be the primary name unless it hugely violates the rules. I tend to use the question "What service does this provide" to come up with a service type identifier.

If we can't figure out the name here, then I'd suggest a post to the openstack-dev mailing list would be a good idea, since it is unlikely we can get the right people into IRC all at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-03-15 04:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-03-15 04:15:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

hi, Chris, thanks for your suggestion. Yeah, i was asking because i am not sure if 'serverless' is a 'thing', but nowadays, seems the word itself has been widely accepted as 'a thing'. However, to avoid confusion, i prefer to use the existing one in qinling devstack plugin."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-21 12:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
zuul: Make openSUSE a voting job

openSUSE only has been reliably passing ever since it switched to the
aio_basekit scenario so make it a voting job in order to start testing
it properly in the integrated repository. Moreover, make sure the
openSUSE OpenStack CI mirror is used throughout the zuul jobs.

Change-Id: I01f90d8d58391215c2a6294093a65daffbc20fcf

commit_message:
Update the nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows description

This patch adds the bit about removing the deleted rows from the
instance_mappings and request_specs tables as well permanently so
that the users are aware of this.

Change-Id: I183cc9f80b3feec6789332860b5aeb7591b710df
(cherry picked from commit 00a0308d2a6736d9846da89557d35c66cb30ea0d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-12 16:32:22.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: New major upgrade workflow implementation.

This patch includes the new upgrades workflow to
upgrade to Queens into the tripleo-upgrade role.
A overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script will be run
to get the HEAT outputs into Ansible playbooks which
will be run later via as many scripts as roles in
the environment (Controller, Compute, etc...).
In each of these scripts the command to run the
downloaded playbooks is executed.

All containers preparation and downloading tasks
have been moved out of the upgrade playbook, so
it becomes a pre-requisite to have uploaded the
right containers before upgrading using this role.

All this new workflow is based on the steps defined
in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535859/

Change-Id: Iae680d97eeef52b9145c290b0b988cb267af3b3d

commit_message:
New major upgrade workflow implementation.

This patch includes the new upgrades workflow to
upgrade to Queens into the tripleo-upgrade role.
A overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script will be run
to get the HEAT outputs into Ansible playbooks which
will be run later via as many scripts as roles in
the environment (Controller, Compute, etc...).
In each of these scripts the command to run the
downloaded playbooks is executed.

All containers preparation and downloading tasks
have been moved out of the upgrade playbook, so
it becomes a pre-requisite to have uploaded the
right containers before upgrading using this role.

All this new workflow is based on the steps defined
in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535859/

Change-Id: Iae680d97eeef52b9145c290b0b988cb267af3b3d
(cherry picked from commit 799eea86d53577be885791cfb3f3e191420d7b65)

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nClean cherrypick LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 17:43:21.000000000', 'message': 'Mariadb online upgrade after yum update

During undercloud upgrade, yum can update the mariadb-server package.
If that is the case and the updated package is a major mariadb update
(e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1, or 10.0 -> 10.1), some database system tables might
need to be updated.

Ensure that mysql_upgrade will be run after a major mariadb update.
Also, force-stop the mariadb server before the upgrade to workaround
a rpm scriptlet limitation when going 5.5 -> 10.1.

Change-Id: Iebc3f39cb2dae355124ba39f7653ef8d20baacc6
(cherry picked from commit c1dd23cd8a890896e98c441d2f5def42b5d0c35e)
'}]
commit_message:
Mariadb online upgrade after yum update

During undercloud upgrade, yum can update the mariadb-server package.
If that is the case and the updated package is a major mariadb update
(e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1, or 10.0 -> 10.1), some database system tables might
need to be updated.

Ensure that mysql_upgrade will be run after a major mariadb update.
Also, force-stop the mariadb server before the upgrade to workaround
a rpm scriptlet limitation when going 5.5 -> 10.1.

Change-Id: Iebc3f39cb2dae355124ba39f7653ef8d20baacc6
(cherry picked from commit c1dd23cd8a890896e98c441d2f5def42b5d0c35e)

commit_message:
Fix newton compat mode for deployed server.

The ControlPlanePort interface changed in the deployed-server
ressource.  It now takes an additional fixed_ips parameters.

This add the required parameter and is required for FFU testing in CI.

Adjust the validation to take the fixed_ips discrepancies between two
different templates interfaces in deployed-neutron-port and
ctlplane-port.

Change-Id: I58af23129bcba04a367d0169dcafd53d33ab42f2
Closes-Bug: #1755837

So you can actually override it during deployment but use the default value if it's not defined? Because right now you don't provide an alternative if the variable is not defined.

 > > > http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_filters.html#omitting-parameters
 > >
 > > hmm that will not work
 > >
 > > https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/22417
 > >
 > > according to the comments the correct way to fix that is to
 > modify
 > > the ODL role to set the default value when one is not supplied.
 > 
 > Even if I change the role so that it takes a value for a
 > non-existing variable, how can I optionally pass the value to the
 > role without duplicating the role call? default(omit) is not an
 > option as it fails and adding something like:
 > 
 > repo_url: "{{ odl_repo_url }}"
 > 
 > will fail when odl_repo_url is not defined.
 > 
 > What about leaving it as it is adding a comment pointing to
 > https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/22417 and as soon as it
 > is fixed, I can change the code?

Wait a little bit because there are still unanswered questions (at least to me) :)

I think you are complicating things a little bit. You are asking the user to define 'odl_repo_url' if they need to override the orl repo correct? Why not pass the suse/deb/centos repo url directly in the user variables? why do you want to do it indirectly? If they don't set the suse/deb/centos variable in their deployment files, then the defaults from the ODL repo will be used. Wouldn't that work? And if no, why?'}, {'account_id': 21883, 'date': '2018-03-21 11:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We can propagate the variable to the roles. ODL role should be changed instead: https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/69752/'}]

commit_message:
Allow choosing different versions of ODL to deploy

To deploy different ODL versions, we need to be able to pass along the repo.
ODL infra publishes one repo per ODL version. Depending on the distro, the user
will fill the variable odl_repo_url in the user_* file.
If the user does not pass any repo, the default repos in opendaylight role will
be used:

https://github.com/opendaylight/integration-packaging-ansible-opendaylight/blob/master/vars/main.yml#L65

Change-Id: Ie6e306fb0147ea7d3fdcd943342b346dacf7d39a
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Stop running get-ansible-role-requirements with -vvv

It generates a lot of console spam and adds very little value to
clone the roles with verbose every time.

Change-Id: If66a4d09dda8bab477c8f8aa8d5cefee7db7ddd9
(cherry picked from commit 758cd74ec10dbe1b83de8230b973764c6a3dc9d7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-24 09:52:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix the wrong device_owner when recreate LBaas listener

Currently, lbaas agent refresh loadbalancer based on the number of active
listener, and will update the port with device_own='' if delete the last
listener in loadbalancer.

So the device_owner of the vip port of exist loadbalancer will never
update to the correct one.

This patch add port device_owner field to PUT to guarantee the field is
'neutron:LOADBALANCERV2'.

Change-Id: I2de5800f4a6b06f98174ef42390f0e2c91bf0cfd
Closes-Bug:#1692995
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the wrong device_owner when recreate LBaas listener

Currently, lbaas agent refresh loadbalancer based on the number of active
listener, and will update the port with device_own='' if delete the last
listener in loadbalancer.

So the device_owner of the vip port of exist loadbalancer will never
update to the correct one.

This patch add port device_owner field to PUT to guarantee the field is
'neutron:LOADBALANCERV2'.

Change-Id: I2de5800f4a6b06f98174ef42390f0e2c91bf0cfd
Closes-Bug:#1692995

commit_message:
Remove the noop deploystep for upgrade converge step

The noop deploystep is set during the prepare step for
upgrade. It put in the plan_env directly, so since we are
keeping the user-env / plan-env for upgrade the noop
steps are never removed.
This patch aim to trigger a mistral action to remove all
the OS::Heat::None for the deploystep/pre/post

Change-Id: If7eb342a84b530b07db513146e85916f2d5c1370

"}]
commit_message:
Fixed insecure passing in keystone module

As Keystone Client is passed already created Session object (L603), it doesn't
take into an account client_args, so Session is created with default verify
value.

Change-Id: I428a80cfb99821053d27dcf8a4b130377467d469

commit_message:
Pull in ubuntu cloud archive openvswitch pkg

The environments for functional and fullstack tests are prepared
differently than others and aren't using UCA.  They should use the
ubuntu cloud archive, too.

Depends-On: Ie18833bfa30f1789e63cbe9c86f5ece3453f43fb
Change-Id: I75374fce0e01bac874107abea0b7389382588905

commit_message:
Break up fixup_stuff

Neutron functional tests want to use ubuntu cloud archive but it's
not possible to source the fixup_stuff.sh from a neutron CI setup
script. Break it up so that only the UCA portion can be executed
from neutron.

Change-Id: Ie18833bfa30f1789e63cbe9c86f5ece3453f43fb

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: I6a3543aa5bfd7e622be76de8b96c1a521d7a1627

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 18:57:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use explicit state rather than subtlety to control when we update root

It is important that a sharding shard does not advertise any of its
sub-shards as being ACTIVE to the root before they have *all* been
cleaved. Then we need the shard to simultaneously inform the root
about its new set of sub-shard ranges and its deleted own shard range.
However, it is useful for sub-shards to becaome ACTIVE as soon as they
are individually cleaved so that listing requests can be redirected to
them. This requires careful control over when cleaved ACTIVE
sub-shards actually got reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard state pushed to newly cleaved
sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root container
updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard is put in state CLEAVED until all shards
have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are simultaneously
moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over what the root
learns: shard containers never report CLEAVED shards to the
root. Otherwise, CLEAVED shard ranges are treated the same as ACTIVE
shard ranges for the purposes of listings etc.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use in listings, update redirection; do not report to root.
ACTIVE -> use in listings, update redirection; report to root.

Change-Id: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
'}, {'created': '2018-03-10 22:23:38.000000000', 'message': 'Use explicit state rather than subtlety to control when we update root

It is important that a sharding shard does not advertise any of its
sub-shards as being ACTIVE to the root before they have *all* been
cleaved. Then we need the shard to simultaneously inform the root
about its new set of sub-shard ranges and its deleted own shard range.
However, it is useful for sub-shards to becaome ACTIVE as soon as they
are individually cleaved so that listing requests can be redirected to
them. This requires careful control over when cleaved ACTIVE
sub-shards actually got reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard state pushed to newly cleaved
sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root container
updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard of a shard is put in state CLEAVED until
all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what the root learns: shard containers never report CLEAVED shards to
the root. Otherwise, CLEAVED shard ranges are treated the same as
ACTIVE shard ranges for the purposes of listings etc.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use in listings, update redirection; do not report to root.
ACTIVE -> use in listings, update redirection; report to root.

Change-Id: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
'}, {'created': '2018-03-12 10:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'Use explicit state rather than subtlety to control when we update root

It is important that a sharding shard does not advertise any of its
sub-shards as being ACTIVE to the root before they have *all* been
cleaved. Then we need the shard to simultaneously inform the root
about its new set of sub-shard ranges and its deleted own shard range.
However, it is useful for sub-shards to becaome ACTIVE as soon as they
are individually cleaved so that listing requests can be redirected to
them. This requires careful control over when cleaved ACTIVE
sub-shards actually got reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard state pushed to newly cleaved
sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root container
updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard of a shard is put in state CLEAVED until
all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what the root learns: shard containers never report CLEAVED shards to
the root. Otherwise, CLEAVED shard ranges are treated the same as
ACTIVE shard ranges for the purposes of listings etc.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use in listings, update redirection; do not report to root.
ACTIVE -> use in listings, update redirection; report to root.

Change-Id: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
'}, {'created': '2018-03-12 15:43:37.000000000', 'message': "Use state rather than subtlety to make shards of shards authoritative

In the root container it is important that sub-shards of a sharding
shard are not considered as being authoritative for the purposes of
listings before they have *all* been cleaved and the sharding shard is
simultaneously deleted.

However, it is useful for sub-shards to considered authoritative by a
sharding shard as soon as they are individually cleaved so that
listing requests to the shard can be redirected to them. Maintaining
this distinction between root and shard behaviour requires careful
control of how cleaved sub-shards are reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard range state pushed to newly
cleaved sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root
container updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard of a shard is put in state CLEAVED until
all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what is considered as authoritative: CLEAVED shard ranges are not
authoritative in the root but CLEAVED shard ranges are considered
authoritative in shards.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use when handling listings of shards but not roots;
   use for update redirection.

ACTIVE -> use when handling listings of shards and roots; use
  for update redirection.

Also, include other shard ranges when updating root...

Before, when a shard container made its periodic update
to the root, it only included its own shard range. Now it
also includes other shard ranges that it knows about, unless
it is shrinking.

This change ensures that when a donor shard has shrunk and
cleaved itself to an acceptor, the acceptor will update the
root with its own new expanded namespace (as before) and the
deleted donor shard range (which wasn't happening before).

Change-Id: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
"}, {'created': '2018-03-12 15:53:27.000000000', 'message': "Use state rather than subtlety to make shards of shards authoritative

In the root container it is important that sub-shards of a sharding
shard are not considered as being authoritative for the purposes of
listings before they have *all* been cleaved and the sharding shard is
simultaneously deleted.

However, it is useful for sub-shards to considered authoritative by a
sharding shard as soon as they are individually cleaved so that
listing requests to the shard can be redirected to them. Maintaining
this distinction between root and shard behaviour requires careful
control of how cleaved sub-shards are reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard range state pushed to newly
cleaved sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root
container updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard of a shard is put in state CLEAVED until
all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what is considered as authoritative: CLEAVED shard ranges are not
authoritative in the root but CLEAVED shard ranges are considered
authoritative in shards.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use when handling listings of shards but not roots;
   use for update redirection.

ACTIVE -> use when handling listings of shards and roots; use
  for update redirection.

Also, include other shard ranges when updating root...

Before, when a shard container made its periodic update
to the root, it only included its own shard range. Now it
also includes other shard ranges that it knows about, unless
it is shrinking.

This change ensures that when a donor shard has shrunk and
cleaved itself to an acceptor, the acceptor will update the
root with its own new expanded namespace (as before) and the
deleted donor shard range (which wasn't happening before).

"}, {'created': '2018-03-12 18:54:25.000000000', 'message': "Use state rather than subtlety to make shards of shards authoritative

shard are not considered as being authoritative for the purposes of

However, it is useful for sub-shards to considered authoritative by a
sharding shard as soon as they are individually cleaved so that
listing requests to the shard can be redirected to them. Maintaining
this distinction between root and shard behaviour requires careful
control of how cleaved sub-shards are reported to the root.

using a subtle distortion of the shard range state pushed to newly

all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what is considered as authoritative: CLEAVED shard ranges are not
authoritative in the root but CLEAVED shard ranges are considered
authoritative in shards.

CLEAVED -> use when handling listings of shards but not roots;

  for update redirection.

Before, when a shard container made its periodic update
to the root, it only included its own shard range. Now it
also includes other shard ranges that it knows about, unless
it is shrinking.

This change ensures that when a donor shard has shrunk and
cleaved itself to an acceptor, the acceptor will update the
root with its own new expanded namespace (as before) and the
deleted donor shard range (which wasn't happening before).

commit_message:
Use state rather than subtlety to make shards of shards authoritative

In the root container it is important that sub-shards of a sharding
shard are not considered as being authoritative for the purposes of
listings before they have *all* been cleaved and the sharding shard is
simultaneously deleted.

However, it is useful for sub-shards to considered authoritative by a
sharding shard as soon as they are individually cleaved so that
listing requests to the shard can be redirected to them. Maintaining
this distinction between root and shard behaviour requires careful
control of how cleaved sub-shards are reported to the root.

Before, we controlled when sub-shards appeared ACTIVE to the root by
using a subtle distortion of the shard range state pushed to newly
cleaved sub-shards, and by not including other shard ranges in root
container updates while in sharding state.

Now, a newly cleaved shard of a shard is put in state CLEAVED until
all shards have been found, at which point all CLEAVED shards are
simultaneously moved to ACTIVE. This enables much simpler control over
what is considered as authoritative: CLEAVED shard ranges are not
authoritative in the root but CLEAVED shard ranges are considered
authoritative in shards.

In summary:

CLEAVED -> use when handling listings of shards but not roots;
   use for update redirection.

ACTIVE -> use when handling listings of shards and roots; use
  for update redirection.

Also, include other shard ranges when updating root...

Before, when a shard container made its periodic update
to the root, it only included its own shard range. Now it
also includes other shard ranges that it knows about, unless
it is shrinking.

This change ensures that when a donor shard has shrunk and
cleaved itself to an acceptor, the acceptor will update the
root with its own new expanded namespace (as before) and the
deleted donor shard range (which wasn't happening before).

Change-Id: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76

commit_message:
Grep command error

Error[1] when executing grep command. add sudo for the grep commands
when it is currently enabled.

[1]:http://logs.openstack.org/63/554163/1/check/puppet-openstack-integration-4-scenario002-tempest-ubuntu-xenial/dd454e9/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-19_08_44_16_398090

Change-Id: I5e5e89a4d691fc3890fbc863caa1fc87e42e7d87
Closes-Bug: #1756832
(cherry picked from commit f8d4883f520c1dcbfd000b37c14607f87ae65932)

commit_message:
Revert "[Fullstack] Mark security group test as unstable"

It is possible that issue with ncat process can be already fixed by [1]
so there is no need to mark as unstable anymore.

This reverts commit 685596f89c02711410bd6b650a12264ca99145fe.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545820/

Change-Id: Ia4ea2ed86ec1fd7aee5428319efb956672c9d1a8

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Iba311cc69ec5272d8beb433e3589c53f371d5d0a

Avoid cloning a repository that is going to change state to verify the
behavior for existing tags.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

show the cwd for commands before running them

If the caller passes a cwd value, display it before showing the
command and running it.

Change-Id: I3f50da28f660dcb0ef9f52b707079ed24ca89ce2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
test SHA validation using a fake repository

Create a local repository instead of cloning one from the git server
for the tests that verify the SHA values being tagged.

Change-Id: I12b65577b93f07d383b9cfa131ef56d68bdd130a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add -W for document build
messages:
[{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-11 20:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-12 01:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If the project has a setup.cfg file with:

     [build_sphinx]
     warnings-is-error=1

then a -W is added:

     sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/html

but setup.cfg in the repo has no "warnings-is-error=1", so -W is not unnecessary.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-12 02:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> If the project has a setup.cfg file with:
 > 
 > [build_sphinx]
 > warnings-is-error=1
 > 
 > then a -W is added:
 > 
 > sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/html
 > 
 > but setup.cfg in the repo has no "warnings-is-error=1", so -W is
 > not unnecessary.

I think it's just an oversight that the warnings-is-error flag was not enabled here.

Please restore this and turn on the flag on.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-12 14:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-12 14:36:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I agree that in general we want -W behavior on doc builds.  Since it seems to work on this repo I'm +2 on adding it."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Yup, we don't use the 'build_sphinx' setuptools command for this project"}]

For more detials information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Id06803a45d088e1e4292598a79b7515d3eb91a11
'}]

commit_message:
make clone_repo.sh work on macOS

The getopt command doesn't work the same under macOS, so don't use it
an process the arguments directly.

Change-Id: Ib4de175e82ec7ece65951ce66692c76caac95aa5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 15:29:16.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ansible-pacemaker is present on the undercloud.

On upstream CI in mixed upgrade the undercloud doesn't have this
package by default.

This make the ffu upgrade fail during ffu_upgrade_playbook with:

  exception: no action detected in task. This often indicates a
  misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

This make sure that this package is installed as it should on "normal"
installation.

Change-Id: Ic3268aa1c0fb84d0039395186861e9dea838a6e3
'}, {'created': '2018-03-19 23:24:02.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ansible-pacemaker is present on the undercloud.

On upstream CI in mixed upgrade the undercloud doesn't have this
package by default.

This make the ffu upgrade fail during ffu_upgrade_playbook with:

  exception: no action detected in task. This often indicates a
  misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

This make sure that this package is installed as it should on "normal"
installation.

Change-Id: Ic3268aa1c0fb84d0039395186861e9dea838a6e3
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker is present on the undercloud.

On upstream CI in mixed upgrade the undercloud doesn't have this
package by default.

This make the ffu upgrade fail during ffu_upgrade_playbook with:

  exception: no action detected in task. This often indicates a
  misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

This make sure that this package is installed as it should on "normal"
installation.

Change-Id: Ic3268aa1c0fb84d0039395186861e9dea838a6e3

commit_message:
Disallow TLS v1.0 from HAProxy

This forces HAProxy to only accept newer versions of TLS, which allows
us to meet FedRAMP requirements.

Conflicts:
      manifests/haproxy.pp

Change-Id: I14f4de3875a743ee5328b13668790b26cefd8439
Related-Bug: #1754368
(cherry picked from commit ebde918b0f0cea8715a30f57ca7c2683dd477c50)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 06:32:00.000000000', 'message': "Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Conflicts:
      spec/classes/tripleo_certmonger_ca_local_spec.rb

Tests didn't exist in this branch, so I added them.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-20 10:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the

commit_message:
Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Conflicts:
      spec/classes/tripleo_certmonger_ca_local_spec.rb

Specs test file didn't exist in this branch, so I removed it.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)

commit_message:
add ml2 config for networking bgpvpn

- provides an option to choose ODL BGVPN
- installs networking-bgpvpn driver
- configures neutron to use ODL BGPVPN driver
- add bgpvpn scenario as a non-voting zuul job
- run networking-bgpvpn tempest

Change-Id: I29b3da7d29399708b2edef2328b174434d081259
(cherry picked from commit ced7cb81e995e8c15e80464e0217798b788ee139)

commit_message:
Ensure workflow check is retried on DB error

On DB error, the _check_and_complete logic is retried. DB disconnect errors
are not shadowed by subsequent DB operations in the failed transaction. Other
non DB disconnect or MistralExceptions are considered fatal, thus, the consistency
check is not rescheduled.

Change-Id: I093d5e2442a5489d406f4b8a188552f201b1a076
Closes-Bug: 1751018

commit_message:
Add some OpenStack networking-* projects to global-requirements 1/2

Now that we're publishing them to PyPI we can begin the work of
reworking the plugin projects to depend on the PyPI versions instead
of listing direct git url depends. To do that, we need them in
global-requirements.

Add networking-odl, networking-bagpipe, networking-bgpvpn,
networking-sfc, networking-l2gw, neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas,
neutron-vpnaas, neutron-dynamic-routing, and vmware-nsxlib.

Add these only to global-requirements for now - that way
tools/tox_install.sh continues to work. As next step we can migrate from
tox_install.sh to requirements and then add the constraints.

Change-Id: I9feeda89b87bd88636170fee25dc6d1c20208e37

[{'created': '2017-10-13 02:43:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix joins in instance_get_all_by_host

Some callers of instance_get_all_by_host are passing
in columns_to_join=[], like the _sync_scheduler_instance_info
periodic task in the compute manager, to avoid unnecessary
joins with other tables.

The problem was columns_to_join wasn't being passed through
to _instance_get_all_query which builds the actual query
method, and defaults to join on info_cache and security_groups.

This fixes the problem by passing through columns_to_join and
provides tests to show it working both with and without the joins.

Change-Id: I69f2ddca8fb0935e03b0f426891d01360940a85a
Closes-Bug: #1680616
(cherry picked from commit d52bcc616f2d1c0df7bad8a6f5a00adc7ad1fb27)

in columns_to_join=[], like the _sync_scheduler_instance_info
periodic task in the compute manager, to avoid unnecessary
joins with other tables.

The problem was columns_to_join wasn't being passed through
to _instance_get_all_query which builds the actual query
method, and defaults to join on info_cache and security_groups.

This fixes the problem by passing through columns_to_join and
provides tests to show it working both with and without the joins.

Change-Id: I69f2ddca8fb0935e03b0f426891d01360940a85a
Closes-Bug: #1680616
(cherry picked from commit d52bcc616f2d1c0df7bad8a6f5a00adc7ad1fb27)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix joins in instance_get_all_by_host

Some callers of instance_get_all_by_host are passing
in columns_to_join=[], like the _sync_scheduler_instance_info
periodic task in the compute manager, to avoid unnecessary
joins with other tables.

The problem was columns_to_join wasn't being passed through
to _instance_get_all_query which builds the actual query
method, and defaults to join on info_cache and security_groups.

This fixes the problem by passing through columns_to_join and
provides tests to show it working both with and without the joins.

Change-Id: I69f2ddca8fb0935e03b0f426891d01360940a85a
Closes-Bug: #1680616
(cherry picked from commit d52bcc616f2d1c0df7bad8a6f5a00adc7ad1fb27)

commit_message:
Allow project/user domain with datasources

get_keystone_session looks for the user_domain_name and
project_domain_name config options but because they are missing
from get_openstack_required_config they cannot be set from the
command line when creating a datasource. This change just adds them
as supported optional config.

Change-Id: Id63dd1af70e5c968adf00cbde17ddb4f27671691
Closes-Bug: #1756095

commit_message:
Add image-delete to python-zunclient

This change adds image delete support to the python-zunclient
project for the image-delete command

The zun command image-delete is now:
    zun image-delete

Change-Id: I64a9e6ed04d63a3171c580f5b234fe61ee346676

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 08:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add heat-policy.json for Queens releases

Heat uses the policy in code approach in Queens rather than using the
policy.json and reflecting that the heat package no longer ships with a
policy.json. However, horizon still needs a heat policy.json.

The oslopolicy-sample-generator was used to generate the heat-policy.json
included in this patch. Credit to Dmitrii-Sh for outlining the approach in the
bug report.

Arguably, the openstack-dashboard package should include the heat-policy.json
so I am only marking this as a partial fix as it may be decided that the
correct approach is a package update, in which case, this is a temporary fix
which can be removed later.

Change-Id: If6046167a8ea2773b12d77e833ed580b7d2952c3
Partial-Bug: #1754508
'}]
commit_message:
Add heat-policy.json for Queens releases

Heat uses the policy in code approach in Queens rather than using the
policy.json and reflecting that the heat package no longer ships with a
policy.json. However, horizon still needs a heat policy.json.

The oslopolicy-sample-generator was used to generate the heat-policy.json
included in this patch. Credit to Dmitrii-Sh for outlining the approach in the
bug report.

Arguably, the openstack-dashboard package should include the heat-policy.json
so I am only marking this as a partial fix as it may be decided that the
correct approach is a package update, in which case, this is a temporary fix
which can be removed later.

Change-Id: If6046167a8ea2773b12d77e833ed580b7d2952c3
Partial-Bug: #1754508

commit_message:
Use oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures

The change in I25e41fc4103b4eafd3aef2b0a863b2053927edad
makes use of oslo_db.tests.*, which was not the intent of the
deprecations added to oslo_db in
I0163e637ffef6d45d2573ebe29b5438911d01fce.   Make use of the
newer fixtures in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures which is
what was intended to supersede oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base.

Change-Id: I67cd8f032cbc4be6469ccb90b9f9a6e552bd963d

commit_message:
Clean up stats dumped to recon cache and logged

- use container.recon file by default
- dump sharding_last, sharding_time and sharding_stats keys
- sharding_stats dict includes all inherited replicator stats
  plus sharder stats
- clean up which stats are updated where in sharder cycle
- log stats for each phase of a sharder cycle on separate line

Change-Id: I15b58529f641fac009dff167ff7fa6f37abda2d6

- gate-tempest-dsvm-zun-multinode-docker-sql-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/00/512000/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-zun-multinode-docker-sql-ubuntu-xenial-nv/7e0b840/ : FAILURE in 40m 16s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-15 23:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Shengqin,

A comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-10-18 01:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Shengqin,
 > 
 > A comment inline.

Hi,hongbin.Thanks for your comment.
I think we use the command "zun cp" for copying static data between host and container.
The option -v is used to bind volumes which store real-time data. 
For example,
$docker run -it --name=sysdig --volume=/dev:/dev --volume=/proc:/proc:ro  ... sysdig/sysdig
If zunclinet read the directory /proc and write to a temporary file in localhost, the data may be inconsistent .

IMO, the administrator would be aware that a special container should be scheduled on which nodes.
We may combine -v and --label options to create a container. WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-18 01:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Hi Shengqin,
 > >
 > > A comment inline.
 > 
 > Hi,hongbin.Thanks for your comment.
 > I think we use the command "zun cp" for copying static data between
 > host and container.
 > The option -v is used to bind volumes which store real-time data.
 > For example,
 > $docker run -it --name=sysdig --volume=/dev:/dev --volume=/proc:/proc:ro
 >  ... sysdig/sysdig
 > If zunclinet read the directory /proc and write to a temporary file
 > in localhost, the data may be inconsistent .
 > 
 > IMO, the administrator would be aware that a special container
 > should be scheduled on which nodes.
 > We may combine -v and --label options to create a container. WDYT?

Let's bring up this discussion at the next team meeting.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-24 14:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Shengqin, several remarks here:

* We leverage the --mount option for cinder volume bindmount. It is better to reuse this option for bind-mounting local file system (i.e. zun run --mount type=local,source=...,destination=... <image>)
* Please ensure only admin can bind-mount local file system since this is a very dangerous operation.
* Suggest to introduce a config (called 'allowed_mount_paths' or equivalent). Operators can tune this config to restrict the path for bind-mounting. For example:

  allowed_mount_paths=/opt/stack/data/zun , ...

This will disallow the following command:

  $ zun run --mount type=local,source=/etc/..,destination=... <image>

Hope this will satisfy what you need without introducing serious security issues ."}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-02 11:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16277, 'date': '2017-11-06 09:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

What if two people are trying to mount the same directory, or someone accidentally fills up the root filesystem by writing data or some other hack? I think this operation as very risky. Please let me know your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-07 01:45:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> What if two people are trying to mount the same directory, or
 > someone accidentally fills up the root filesystem by writing data
 > or some other hack? I think this operation as very risky. Please
 > let me know your thoughts.

Thanks, Pradeep.
Currently,
1.only admin can bind-mount local file system to container.
2.zun introduces a config (called 'forbidden_volume.conf') so that operators can tune this config to restrict the path for bind-mounting.

In order to solve the problem of repeat mount, we can check  whether it is in use. WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 16277, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:02:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > What if two people are trying to mount the same directory, or
 > > someone accidentally fills up the root filesystem by writing data
 > > or some other hack? I think this operation as very risky. Please
 > > let me know your thoughts.
 > 
 > Thanks, Pradeep.
 > Currently,
 > 1.only admin can bind-mount local file system to container.
 > 2.zun introduces a config (called 'forbidden_volume.conf') so that
 > operators can tune this config to restrict the path for
 > bind-mounting.
 > 
 > In order to solve the problem of repeat mount, we can check 
 > whether it is in use. WDYT?

In multitenant environment giving access to host does not seem ok to me. Isn't there a way to solve your use case by other means?"}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-15 05:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-11-16 00:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Sorry for the frequent amending, my fault, hopefully the last patchset should be fine.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-03-01 15:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Thank you!

Little things:
- two tests have the same name, please define different names :)
- please split tests into testfunctions, for now a lot of tests are inside one big test functions,
- if you have any common set of instructions - please move it to helper function and call it in specific test if needed
- tests should be named properly, just to know from test name for example: what parameter is under test, what we test'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-03-02 01:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(11 comments)

> (11 comments)
 > 
 > Thank you!
 > 
 > Little things:
 > - two tests have the same name, please define different names :)

The names of the two newly added testing function is not the same, please refer to my inline comments.

 > - please split tests into testfunctions, for now a lot of tests are
 > inside one big test functions,

How to arrange testing functions is based what we're going to check, I think it's better form to include multiple checking inisde a testing function for these two tests, for more detailed explanation, please see my inline comments.

 > - if you have any common set of instructions - please move it to
 > helper function and call it in specific test if needed

Didn't get your point about this one as I don't think splitting tests is a good idea here.

 > - tests should be named properly, just to know from test name for
 > example: what parameter is under test, what we test

The names of the two newly added testing functions are quite straightforward for me. Please let me know what you think about these functions where you see the names, thanks, :)"}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-03-07 01:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Maciej, any new comments for this? Would the other core members help to review this, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-24 07:53:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix guestagent.test_operating_system for Python3

* Tests for _write_file_as_root failed because tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile
  use binary mode by default, changing to text mode fixes.
* Migrate to olso_serialization.base64 for Base64Codec. Also change the
  return value from bytearray to bytes for Base64Codec.deserialize.
  Base64Codec supports reverse encoding(i.e. binary data will be written
  to the dest file), in this situation, the dest file should be opened
  with binary mode(and when reading from the file, binary mode should
  also be used).
* stream_codecs.StringConverter converts iterable objects with map
  function. The behavior of map function is different under Python 2.x
  and 3.x. However csv.writerows(before Python 3.5) and unpack_singleton in
  trove.common.utils both need a list object. Converting the return
  value of map function to a list explicitly before passing to these
  functions fixes.

guestagent.test_operating_system is the last blacklist regex pattern for
py3 unittests. With the above problems fixed, blacklist-py3.txt is not
needed any more, and tox.ini is also updateted.

Migrating from ostestr to stestr is also done while updating tox.ini.
Here is the ML post for more information about os-testr and stestr:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I31f1f97901d6ebff8a91c1b70a343e724ab806eb
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix guestagent.test_operating_system for Python3

* Tests for _write_file_as_root failed because tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile
  use binary mode by default, changing to text mode fixes.
* Migrate to olso_serialization.base64 for Base64Codec. Also change the
  return value from bytearray to bytes for Base64Codec.deserialize.
  Base64Codec supports reverse encoding(i.e. binary data will be written
  to the dest file), in this situation, the dest file should be opened
  with binary mode(and when reading from the file, binary mode should
  also be used).
* stream_codecs.StringConverter converts iterable objects with map
  function. The behavior of map function is different under Python 2.x
  and 3.x. However csv.writerows(before Python 3.5) and unpack_singleton in
  trove.common.utils both need a list object. Converting the return
  value of map function to a list explicitly before passing to these
  functions fixes.

guestagent.test_operating_system is the last blacklist regex pattern for
py3 unittests. With the above problems fixed, blacklist-py3.txt is not
needed any more, and tox.ini is also updateted.

Migrating from ostestr to stestr is also done while updating tox.ini.
Here is the ML post for more information about os-testr and stestr:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I31f1f97901d6ebff8a91c1b70a343e724ab806eb
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

Here's a recent example of the failure due to the missing test-requirement:

http://logs.openstack.org/19/537819/4/check/openstack-tox-py27/cd7322c/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-20_17_17_47_300574"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17780, 'date': '2018-03-20 20:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I had snagged the master version of python-manilaclient from Github just a bit ago and had to manually install os-testr on my machine to make it work. With this patch and os-testr removed from the system libraries (dnf remove python3-os-testr), I was able to run unit tests with a virtual environment set up with Python 3.5 and was able to run "tox -e py35" and "tox -e py27" without incident.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-03-21 03:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2018-03-21 03:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-21 03:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]

Just FYI, I've got this error :

Setting up HEAT's output for major upgrade
openstack: 'overcloud upgrade prepare --templates --container-registry-file /home/zuul/overcloud_containers.yaml --stack overcloud -e /home/zuul/UpgradeInitCommand.yaml' is not an openstack command. See 'openstack --help'.
Did you mean one of these?


http://logs.openstack.org/62/545762/16/experimental/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oc-upgrade/d02d4be/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.log.txt.gz

Is it expected and should I add some patches in ?"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-03-02 06:28:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Just FYI, I've got this error :
 > 
 > Setting up HEAT's output for major upgrade
 > openstack: 'overcloud upgrade prepare --templates --container-registry-file
 > /home/zuul/overcloud_containers.yaml --stack overcloud -e
 > /home/zuul/UpgradeInitCommand.yaml' is not an openstack command.
 > See 'openstack --help'.
 > Did you mean one of these?
 > 
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/62/545762/16/experimental/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oc-upgrade/d02d4be/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.log.txt.gz
 > 
 > Is it expected and should I add some patches in ?

That's mainly because the patch doesn't import the P->Q workflow implemented in here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545365/8, so it can't find the code of the new workflow."}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 16:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: New major upgrade workflow implementation.

This patch includes the new upgrades
workflow to upgrade to Queens into the
role.

All containers preparation and downloading
tasks have been moved out of the upgrade
playbook, so it becomes a pre-requisite to
have uploaded the right containers before
upgrading using this role.

Change-Id: Iae680d97eeef52b9145c290b0b988cb267af3b3d

'}, {'created': '2018-02-28 17:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: New major upgrade workflow implementation.

This patch includes the new upgrades workflow to upgrade to Queens into the
tripleo-upgrade role. A overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script will be run
to get the HEAT outputs into Ansible playbooks which will be run later via
as many scripts as roles in the environment (Controller, Compute, etc...).
In each of these scripts the command to run the downloaded playbooks is
executed.

All containers preparation and downloading tasks have been moved out of the upgrade
playbook, so it becomes a pre-requisite to have uploaded the right containers before
upgrading using this role.

All this new workflow is based on the steps defined in [0]

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535859/

Change-Id: Iae680d97eeef52b9145c290b0b988cb267af3b3d

will be run later via as many scripts as roles in
the environment (Controller, Compute, etc...).
In each of these scripts the command to run the
downloaded playbooks is executed.

All containers preparation and downloading tasks
have been moved out of the upgrade playbook, so
it becomes a pre-requisite to have uploaded the
right containers before upgrading using this role.

All this new workflow is based on the steps defined
in [0].

commit_message:
New major upgrade workflow implementation.

This patch includes the new upgrades workflow to
upgrade to Queens into the tripleo-upgrade role.
A overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script will be run
to get the HEAT outputs into Ansible playbooks which
will be run later via as many scripts as roles in
the environment (Controller, Compute, etc...).
In each of these scripts the command to run the
downloaded playbooks is executed.

All containers preparation and downloading tasks
have been moved out of the upgrade playbook, so
it becomes a pre-requisite to have uploaded the
right containers before upgrading using this role.

All this new workflow is based on the steps defined
in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535859/

Change-Id: Iae680d97eeef52b9145c290b0b988cb267af3b3d

[{'created': '2018-03-19 22:28:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I7afa363b41b42f7dbd1e31a68b65f122eeffc447
'}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I7afa363b41b42f7dbd1e31a68b65f122eeffc447

[{'created': '2018-01-03 04:48:27.000000000', 'message': 'Update OOB RAID for iLO5 based HPE Proliant Servers

This commit is to update OOB raid spec to add additional clean
step ``read_configuration`` for out-of-band raid creation to
get the raid config from the system.

Change-Id: Ibb820b624faca275f8266f6b9d18efb2a83326f8
'}, {'created': '2018-01-15 10:30:28.000000000', 'message': 'Update OOB RAID for iLO5 based HPE Proliant Servers

This commit is to update OOB raid spec to add additional clean

commit_message:
Update OOB RAID for iLO5 based HPE Proliant Servers

This commit is to update OOB raid spec to add additional clean
step ``read_configuration`` for out-of-band raid creation to
get the raid config from the system.

Change-Id: Ibb820b624faca275f8266f6b9d18efb2a83326f8

subject: zuul: create Neutron config dir for the devstack job
messages:
[{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-20 04:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27732, 'date': '2018-03-20 04:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-20 04:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-20 05:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-20 05:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-20 06:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-03-20 06:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

hi, Hunt, does that mean without this patch our devstack gate will definitely fail?'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-21 01:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> hi, Hunt, does that mean without this patch our devstack gate will
 > definitely fail?

Unfortunately yes. The base devstack job assumes neutron-api to be enabled and will always generate a post-config in local.conf to update the neutron config[1]. We have it disabled as Qinling doesn't require Neutron to work.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/34e09dd3a90e7782a96c5a500368cad04f553e1c/.zuul.yaml#L252-L256"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-03-21 03:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

ok, thanks for the investigation!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 04:08:00.000000000', 'message': "zuul: create Neutron config dir for the devstack job

This commit is a workaround to create a Neutron config dir to satisfy
devstack when the Neutron service is actually disabled.

commit_message:
zuul: create Neutron config dir for the devstack job

With [1] the devstack zuul job will try to update Neutron's
configuration, even though we don't use Neutron for Qinling at all.

This commit is a workaround to create a Neutron config dir to satisfy
devstack when the Neutron service is actually disabled.

[1] I2dcbd9bdb401860820e655d97aa3c4775af2827f

Change-Id: I6ecc7d631c7deccf7d5011ec68a08759441a0318

commit_message:
Add a full set of tests for the IPMI hardware type to the standalone job

This makes sure that when we remove classic drivers, the standalone job
still tests all combinations of deploy methods and image types.

Change-Id: I90f8b42113d6621c7af644fdb4c76d5f3dde318e

commit_message:
Allow networkd filename override

- Allow configuring the default filename format
- Allow configuring a filename override on a per netdev/network
  basis.

commit_message:
Change include: to include_tasks:

This removes warnings in Ansible 2.4+.

The patch also removes "static:" arguments which are no longer
used by Ansible.

Change-Id: I6341e694cee527b4bcf46f813c09db9f1bcabb00
(cherry picked from commit 044025ca0a2a68d143499fa3601902ed688320b0)

messages:
[{'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-08 12:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-08 14:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-08 15:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-08 15:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-10 21:59:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks for taking this up.

This will also require a reno with deprecation notes about this change.

Also may we attribute original author(s) of the abandoned change (only if this borrows from it, else disregard) with Co-Authored-By tags in commit message, please?'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-12 11:10:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the incredibly useful/thorough feedback. For this change:

murano/common/config.py, Line 282:

Will also need to keep:

    CONF.register_opts(murano_rabbit_opts, group='rabbitmq')

...should this not be:

    CONF.register_opts(rabbit_opts, group='rabbitmq')

...in order to not break on the other snipped you linked?"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:58:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Thanks for the incredibly useful/thorough feedback. For this
 > change:
 > 
 > murano/common/config.py, Line 282:
 > 
 > Will also need to keep:
 > 
 > CONF.register_opts(murano_rabbit_opts, group='rabbitmq')
 > 
 > ...should this not be:
 > 
 > CONF.register_opts(rabbit_opts, group='rabbitmq')
 > 
 > ...in order to not break on the other snipped you linked?

Yes, that's correct. Sorry for the typo."}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-12 14:32:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-12 15:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-12 16:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

There are a few other references to rabbitmq that are still left in the code: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=rabbitmq&i=nope&files=&repos=murano

* http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/murano/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n84
* http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/murano/tree/doc/source/admin/deploy_murano/install_manually.rst#n134
* http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/murano/tree/doc/source/admin/deploy_murano/configure_ssl.rst#n88

Also will need reno with deprecation notes. See: https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html#creating-new-release-notes

Then we will need something like this in the reno that is generated by reno new <reno-slug-name>:

---
  - List upgrade notes here, or remove this section.
deprecations:
  - |
    The ``[rabbitmq]`` configuration group has been deprecated and renamed to
    ``[murano_rabbitmq]`` to differentiate between internal communication and
    engine<> VM communication. ``[rabbitmq]`` will be removed during the "S"
    release cycle.'}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:39:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Yes, I added a reno but the checkin for patch set 7 didn't pick it up - I'll re-add it.

Regarding the rabbit_opts stanza in config.py - I left both sections in to avoid future confusion over whether it was just something we neglected to take out this time or not - but I'm happy to take care of it either way."}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-03-13 01:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

@Felipe, I don't think we still need register the old rabbitmq section, code [1] just judgement whether have the old rabbitmq section then give the deprecated warning.

Add also still some changes need to implement in murano-agent, thanks

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550815/4/murano/engine/system/common.py@29"}, {'account_id': 15279, 'date': '2018-03-13 09:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-03-21 02:11:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

@Felipe, I don't think we still need register the old rabbitmq section, code [1] just judgement whether have the old rabbitmq section then give the deprecated warning.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550815/4/murano/engine/system/common.py@29"}]

commit_message:
Rename rabbitmq config section

Continuing from abandoned earlier patch. Renaming the 'rabbitmq' section to
differentiate between internal communication and engine<>VM communication

Change-Id: Ia4788f0230ea702428d5f7e166e5b37ed8fa4ce1
Closes-Bug: 1627705
Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixed insecure passing in keystone module

As Keystone Client is passed already created Session object (L603), it doesn't
take into an account client_args, so Session is created with default verify
value.

Change-Id: I428a80cfb99821053d27dcf8a4b130377467d469

We are only doing a copy.copy() on context when we do target_cell(),
which may mean we're sharing more across threads than we intend to.
This makes that a full regeneration of the context (like we would

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having changes

Iccdf6b80f5fc8adcc8a89ce6ece3f37b6cbcaee2 in Ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1722404
Change-Id: Id24dea7465bafc1f6f58c4a121c4ffb35b7a634a
(cherry picked from commit 42b70509c6e632b0553e92d8ff04cb4cecaa563c)
(cherry picked from commit 42e5b7549e8b920e682204f5745454c0680ec0fb)
"}]
commit_message:
Regenerate context during targeting

We are only doing a copy.copy() on context when we do target_cell(),
which may mean we're sharing more across threads than we intend to.
This makes that a full regeneration of the context (like we would
do over RPC). This will necessarily dump the targeting, if already
set, and any per-thread database context.

Conflicts:
      nova/context.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having changes
If63a4fa7349890a6e7ac0fa3fe12917dc53334d0 or
Iccdf6b80f5fc8adcc8a89ce6ece3f37b6cbcaee2 in Ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1722404
Change-Id: Id24dea7465bafc1f6f58c4a121c4ffb35b7a634a
(cherry picked from commit 42b70509c6e632b0553e92d8ff04cb4cecaa563c)
(cherry picked from commit 42e5b7549e8b920e682204f5745454c0680ec0fb)

python-novaclient 10.0.0 removed the deprecated multinic
python API bindings (add_fixed_ip/remove_fixed_ip) and the
floating IP add/remove methods (floating_ip_add/floating_ip_remove).

Therefore we need to change how the existing server CLIs deal
with these removed methods and use the networking client instead,
and we should deprecate the CLIs while we're at it so we don't
have to maintain this bridge code.

Change-Id: Id2b015a733350578fefb80328ea27cc8217c6821
Closes-Bug: #1745795

commit_message:
WIP: Deprecate server add/remove floating, remove fixed CLIs

python-novaclient 10.0.0 removed the deprecated multinic
python API bindings (add_fixed_ip/remove_fixed_ip) and the
floating IP add/remove methods (floating_ip_add/floating_ip_remove).

Therefore we need to change how the existing server CLIs deal
with these removed methods and use the networking client instead,
and we should deprecate the CLIs while we're at it so we don't
have to maintain this bridge code.

Change-Id: Id2b015a733350578fefb80328ea27cc8217c6821
Closes-Bug: #1745795

to override it. This is helpful when you want to use 2 different

commit_message:
Add container_user to SSH connection plugin

This exposes the container_user setting to an operator and allows them
to override it. This is helpful when you want to use 2 different
username for your physical_host user and container user.  Today if the
physical_host user is root, the container user will always be root
too.

Change-Id: Ie8e32b0441a5d72fcbc3cbf9769d8a7dc7548f08
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 16:48:12.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a hint when performing a volume action can't find the method

There is no CLI for the os-force_detach volume action API, and while
making a request for it with curl, I mistakenly used the Accept
header rather than the Content-Type header and got the unhelpful
error message:

  "There is no such action: None"

We can provide some simple details in the error message about
making sure the request body is correct and that the Content-Type
header is specified to help the user.

Change-Id: I00600c297e39c0dd097f9da80b1dccb38ee3d235
Closes-Bug: #1749983
'}, {'created': '2018-02-19 14:21:25.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a hint when performing a server action can't find the method

I mistakenly used the Accept header rather than the Content-Type
header and got the unhelpful error message:

  "There is no such action: None"

We can provide some simple details in the error message about
making sure the request body is correct and that the Content-Type
header is specified to help the user.

Change-Id: I00600c297e39c0dd097f9da80b1dccb38ee3d235
Closes-Bug: #1749983
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a hint when performing a server action can't find the method

I mistakenly used the Accept header rather than the Content-Type
header and got the unhelpful error message:

  "There is no such action: None"

We can provide some simple details in the error message about
making sure the request body is correct and that the Content-Type
header is specified to help the user.

Change-Id: I00600c297e39c0dd097f9da80b1dccb38ee3d235
Closes-Bug: #1749983

There is a lack of consistency around terminology for port groups/bonds/port channels/other, but let's try to be consistent within ironic/NGS. commit_message:
Support ironic bond

The switch automatically configuring the trunk interface for ironic bond.
Use the local_group_information information in port to
create trunk and delete the trunk interface.

Fixes Bug: #1753876

Change-Id: I64e9433a3cb9f120490c4466e76ffd7d00d0133f

commit_message:
Solving permission errors due to directory ownership on NFS

We do the same work as the GlusterfsBackupDriver, uses chgrp+chmod to set
proper permissions on the directories if needs be.

Change-Id: Ic57c122311039af159c0cfc083e6e9349702d1e4
Closes-Bug: #1715456
(cherry picked from commit dd4c31f527e2c8f93fdfa55fe6713e0e32d94cc9)
(cherry picked from commit 0f3fb16ba3da0fdfc816887aa06920740824bc68)
(cherry picked from commit 9d06094c26dee3d5a87b5ad8fb70f0424ee432f9)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py

commit_message:
nimble: update documentation for supportability

- update the ocata supportability for Nimble OS
- update supportability for single subnet with multiple interfaces
- remove unsupportability for unicode

Change-Id: I419fdb69f27232663aaa4bff5fa3ec925cb221d4
Closes-Bug: 1755546

commit_message:
Fix incorrect usage of assertEqual() method in RBD unit tests

This patch is to fix some incorrect usage of assertEqual() method in RBD
unit tests, and the right way is to use with assertEqual(expected, actual).

Change-Id: Ib38890e5cffbbd5dd2c31fad35bfba442519df26

commit_message:
Add more infos into error message

It is way more convenient to tell the user exactly how much
space was found and what is the minimal size required instead
of forcing him to go through the source code.

Change-Id: I6aafca34ba9dc3a3a45a3ac01848eefeca2ad03d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 06:55:23.000000000', 'message': 'Change a parameter key for CIFS mounting command

While Huawei driver mounting CIFS filesystem, the username parameter
key passed to the mount command is by the form of "user=***", which's
compatible as "username=***" in Ubuntu. However, for some other
systems, such as Redhat, it is not valid.

This patch changes it to the more compatible form "username=***".

Change-Id: Ifa2ca7bcdceef2d47e2841a27ddf51d86f1ef63c
Closes-Bug: #1740816
(cherry picked from commit 5ef160ca7511ca92d8735cfca7bd176dee8ed995)
'}]
commit_message:
Change a parameter key for CIFS mounting command

While Huawei driver mounting CIFS filesystem, the username parameter
key passed to the mount command is by the form of "user=***", which's
compatible as "username=***" in Ubuntu. However, for some other
systems, such as Redhat, it is not valid.

This patch changes it to the more compatible form "username=***".

Change-Id: Ifa2ca7bcdceef2d47e2841a27ddf51d86f1ef63c
Closes-Bug: #1740816
(cherry picked from commit 5ef160ca7511ca92d8735cfca7bd176dee8ed995)

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-02 21:45:00.000000000', 'message': "(WIP)DVR:Pro-active router creation with live migration

Today DVR routers are created after a dvr service port is
seen on a given node. But in the case of instance live
migration, the creation of l3 routed networks on the
destination node is delayed since we react to the event.

This patch tries to proactively create routers on the
destination node based on the portbinding profile info
updated by the nova when the instance is on a pre-migration
state.

Nova calls setup_network_on_host during the pre-migration
phase and we update the portbinding profile dict with
two attributes
'state' = 'migration' and
'destination' = 'host-id' ( destination host id)

Based on the portbinding profile information in the port,
the ml2 plugin will notify the L3 plugin if there is a profile
update.

L3 plugin will verify the profile state and then take action
to create routers in the respective agents if routers have not
been created.

Change-Id: Ibb62f012333cfdfd468bafdc0b4501aa46b4b54d
Related-Bug: #1456073
