"}, {'created': '2016-03-14 16:42:56.000000000', 'message': "DVR:Pro-active router creation with live migration

Today DVR routers are created after a dvr service port is
seen on a given node. But in the case of instance live
migration, the creation of l3 routed networks on the
destination node is delayed since we react to the event.

This patch tries to proactively create routers on the
destination node based on the portbinding profile info
updated by the nova when the instance is on a pre-migration
state.

Nova calls setup_network_on_host during the pre-migration
phase and we update the portbinding profile dict with
an attribute 'migrating_to' as shown below

port:{'binding:profile':{'migrating_to': 'host'}}

where 'host' points to the 'destination' of the port.

L3 plugin will verify the migration profile for the port on
any port update and then take action to create routers in the
respective agents if routers have not been created.

If the live migration fails or if reverted, then the port
binding profile attribute 'migrating_to' will be cleared from
the port profile. In this case, the router and the fip namespace
may be created on the destination node, but since the VM did
not land on the destination node, it would not cause any issues,
since the traffic will still be flowing out from the origination
node, except for the existence of the router and fip namespace.

For some reason if the creation of the router namespace and fip
namespace fails, then the live migration may still proceed as
it is now and the agent will create the router namespace and fip
namespace reactively.

The case were we report status back to Nova and Nova reacting
to the setup_networks_on_host status will be handled in the
upcoming release.

Change-Id: Ibb62f012333cfdfd468bafdc0b4501aa46b4b54d
Related-Bug: #1456073

port:{'binding:profile':{'migrating_to': 'host'}}

where 'host' points to the 'destination' of the port.

any port update and then take action to create routers in the

commit_message:
DVR:Pro-active router creation with live migration

Today DVR routers are created after a dvr service port is
seen on a given node. But in the case of instance live
migration, the creation of l3 routed networks on the
destination node is delayed since we react to the event.

This patch tries to proactively create routers on the
destination node based on the portbinding profile info
updated by the nova when the instance is on a pre-migration
state.

Nova calls setup_network_on_host during the pre-migration
phase and we update the portbinding profile dict with
an attribute 'migrating_to' as shown below

port:{'binding:profile':{'migrating_to': 'host'}}

where 'host' points to the 'destination' of the port.

L3 plugin will verify the migration profile for the port on
any port update and then take action to create routers in the
respective agents if routers have not been created.

If the live migration fails or if reverted, then the port
binding profile attribute 'migrating_to' will be cleared from
the port profile. In this case, the router and the fip namespace
may be created on the destination node, but since the VM did
not land on the destination node, it would not cause any issues,
since the traffic will still be flowing out from the origination
node, except for the existence of the router and fip namespace.

For some reason if the creation of the router namespace and fip
namespace fails, then the live migration may still proceed as
it is now and the agent will create the router namespace and fip
namespace reactively.

The case were we report status back to Nova and Nova reacting
to the setup_networks_on_host status will be handled in the
upcoming release.

This patch should not affect any upgrades with respect to the
agent or server.

Change-Id: Ibb62f012333cfdfd468bafdc0b4501aa46b4b54d
Related-Bug: #1456073

commit_message:
Switch keystone authentication calls to admin ep

Ensure that the keystone admin endpoint is used for calls
to keystone, resolving issues when the public ep is not
network accessible from the neutron-gateway units.

Change-Id: I79a1183e7eddd4981367baf4a22fe2ec6374b0b9
Closes-Bug: 1756111

commit_message:
Simplify tox.ini

Simplify tox.ini install since it will not
fetch the correct horizon tree and will cause
the runs to fail.

Change-Id: I331d3a78cd674a88a57d981eea4514341be337c3
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add script tool to manage container db shard ranges

- find shard ranges
- inject shard ranges to a db
- show db shard ranges
- show db sharding info
- delete existing shard ranges

Change-Id: I1201708de4e9b0ab73af52af42ab346ad0ffa598

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 12:12:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

This patches fixes the incorrect behavior of the backup abort mechanism
to prevent leaving things behind.

Closes-Bug: #1746559
Change-Id: Idcfdbf815f404982d26618710a291054f19be736
(cherry picked from commit 4ff9e63707e2c4cf5869f28e3e86fd0606d2db9a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

This patches fixes the incorrect behavior of the backup abort mechanism
to prevent leaving things behind.

Closes-Bug: #1746559
Change-Id: Idcfdbf815f404982d26618710a291054f19be736
(cherry picked from commit 4ff9e63707e2c4cf5869f28e3e86fd0606d2db9a)

[{'created': '2018-03-20 13:08:27.000000000', 'message': 'Handle exceptions in _send_shard_ranges

direct_client can raise other exception types in addition to
DirectClientException so make sure they are all handled in the spawned

Also allow a custom user agent header to be passed through direct
client.

Change-Id: I87578db750527b822b5038fd2b6dcedce278a74e
'}]
commit_message:
Handle exceptions in _send_shard_ranges

direct_client can raise other exception types in addition to
DirectClientException so make sure they are all handled in the spawned
thread.

Also allow a custom user agent header to be passed through direct
client.

Change-Id: I87578db750527b822b5038fd2b6dcedce278a74e

commit_message:
Remove version/date from CLI documentation

This patch removes the unnecessary maintenance of a date and version
from the CLI documentation.

NOTE: Cinder team also did the same removal with
      the commit Idf78bbed44f942bb6976ccf4da67c748d9283ed9

commit_message:
Refresh the ceilometer.conf file provided by Ceilosca

monasca-ceilometer repo has an example copy of the ceilometer.conf
file used for devstack deployment and as an example.  Ceilometer
project has made a few changes in Pike and Queens (including
removal of the famous v2 API), so some options have changed.

Also noticed a typo in devstack/plugin.sh.

Change-Id: I2dabefd825bbe131b42d435af479075f8a372e0d

commit_message:
Allow instances to be booted with trusted virtual function

The inability to modify VF mac addresses in the guest prevents the
users from being able to setup up two VFs in a fail-over bond.
This spec aims to provide a way for users to boot instances with trusted VFs.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint sriov-trusted-vfs
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I3220ea784ae8f8b809bf732725aaf2d92266683f

commit_message:
Always pass 'NUMACell.siblings' to _pack_instance_onto_cores'

Now that we're populating the aforementioned attribute with cores that
don't have siblings, we don't need to continue creating imitation lists
of "siblings".

Change-Id: Ia371684dd9f821f214c6e023845875021848ca0a
Related-Bug: #1744965

commit_message:
Reduce stestr concurrency to 1 for tempest jobs

The switch from ostestr to stestr introduced in Change-Id
Ie6a275170ec6faf0db3976410660f52078710a54 missed setting concurrency
jobs to 1 for api and scenario tests, leading to intermittent gate
issues.

This patch also fixes coverage test that got broken in the
aforementioned Change-Id.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542223/
Change-Id: I077330ad6f0308845d1b5330040be6f92c39580d
(cherry picked from commit d871c2a7fb57f4e99ea74ff26e8037a9316b696d)

subject: Nova is configured to use multipath and we're trying to start an instance with attached volumes.
messages:
[{'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-03-20 21:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-20 21:55:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-03-20 22:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I created this change with wrong identity information.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 21:55:39.000000000', 'message': 'Nova is configured to use multipath and we're trying to start an instance with attached volumes.

While starting the instance, nova performs iSCSI discovery and obtains a list of 4 (ip, iqn, lun) tuples that it should use for constructing a multipath device.
4 iSCSI sessions are started, and the LUNs appear as block devices in Linux - let's call them /dev/sda, /dev/sdb, /dev/sdc and /dev/sdd.
Then, apperently, os-brick tries to find the WWN of any of our devices by globbing for "/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-*", iterating over all found symlinks, and seeing if any of them leads to any of our 4 devices.
The above fails (yields no result), because no links from /dev/disk/by-id point to our devices anymore - udev replaces those with links to /dev/dm-* devices because of udev rules.
The lack of a WWN causes os-brick's multipath logic to be skipped completely (the multipath branch is only entered if at least one device's WWN can be found).

In nova-compute.log, this manifests itself as this particular log entry:
"No dm was created, connection to volume is probably bad and will perform poorly."
(In fact, of course, the dm device is still there, only its parts are no represented by proper links in /dev/disk/by-id/.)

All of the above causes os-brick to attach our volume in a "degraded" mode - in virsh, it can be observed thar only one of the underlying "single-path" devices, such as /dev/sda, is used as the volume backing store, instead of using the multipath device.

Change-Id: Ia3d3136caedd51686ac49dcceacff04e7c627c7b
'}]
commit_message:
Nova is configured to use multipath and we're trying to start an instance with attached volumes.

While starting the instance, nova performs iSCSI discovery and obtains a list of 4 (ip, iqn, lun) tuples that it should use for constructing a multipath device.
4 iSCSI sessions are started, and the LUNs appear as block devices in Linux - let's call them /dev/sda, /dev/sdb, /dev/sdc and /dev/sdd.
Then, apperently, os-brick tries to find the WWN of any of our devices by globbing for "/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-*", iterating over all found symlinks, and seeing if any of them leads to any of our 4 devices.
The above fails (yields no result), because no links from /dev/disk/by-id point to our devices anymore - udev replaces those with links to /dev/dm-* devices because of udev rules.
The lack of a WWN causes os-brick's multipath logic to be skipped completely (the multipath branch is only entered if at least one device's WWN can be found).

In nova-compute.log, this manifests itself as this particular log entry:
"No dm was created, connection to volume is probably bad and will perform poorly."
(In fact, of course, the dm device is still there, only its parts are no represented by proper links in /dev/disk/by-id/.)

All of the above causes os-brick to attach our volume in a "degraded" mode - in virsh, it can be observed thar only one of the underlying "single-path" devices, such as /dev/sda, is used as the volume backing store, instead of using the multipath device.

Change-Id: Ia3d3136caedd51686ac49dcceacff04e7c627c7b
topic: Nova falling back to single path when using multipath device

In the era of mox, we usually use tuples for create_stubs.
create_mocks was introduced to achieve the similar functionality
in mock testing and we can use a tuple and a list equivalently.
A tuple is used more commonly in our mock tests so far, it sounds
better to document in thd docstring of create_mocks.

Change-Id: Ie2e31a7a4f4d205b19190be5960770f83e1ce858
'}, {'created': '2018-02-23 16:15:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update docstring of test.helpers.create_mocks

In the era of mox, we usually use tuples for create_stubs.
create_mocks was introduced to achieve the similar functionality
in mock testing, but the docstring says to use a list instead of
a tuple. On the other hand, a tuple is used more commonly in our
mock tests so far, it sounds better to document in the docstring
of create_mocks.

While a tuple and a list works equivalently, I was suggested from
other horizon developers to use either of them consistently.
Although I am not against using a list, this commit updates the docstring
to recommend a tuple.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: Ie2e31a7a4f4d205b19190be5960770f83e1ce858
'}, {'created': '2018-02-28 12:14:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update docstring of test.helpers.create_mocks

This commit improves examples in the docstring of create_mocks.

Note that we agreed to use a list over a tuple to define methods
to be mocked for consistency in general.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: Ie2e31a7a4f4d205b19190be5960770f83e1ce858
'}]
commit_message:
Update docstring of test.helpers.create_mocks

This commit improves examples in the docstring of create_mocks.

Note that we agreed to use a list over a tuple to define methods
to be mocked for consistency in general.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: Ie2e31a7a4f4d205b19190be5960770f83e1ce858

[docs] Add information about supported & stable tests

This is to add documentation about the stability and correctness
of current RBAC tests in Patrole and briefly lay out a roadmap
for test stability.

commit_message:
Correct the response code of attach

The attach operation will return the URL that can be used to attach
to the container. The success response code is 200 instead of 202.

Change-Id: Ia467d6521e96df9e0338e129c85c13ad72124718
(cherry picked from commit f4f84de2a9460e1703dbc781b38f901e9a4c36ec)

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Mark security group test as unstable

As is described in related bug report this tests is failing
quite often due to some problem with spawning "ncat" process.

Change-Id: I0651da07fb786cce82262703bfab8ca30ad4125d
Related-Bug: 1744402

commit_message:
Add method repr() to NovaException

Add method repr() to NovaException so that kwargs are not
removed when the exception is serialized. The change to return
repr(Exception) instead of serializing the individual variables
and arguments of the exception is
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8.

Closes-Bug: #1756360
Change-Id: If26a5785a453466c5795369573f7a109616f24c9

commit_message:
rehome create functions from plugin utils

While we rehomed a bulk of the plugin utils with commit
Iabb155b5d2d0ec6104ebee5dd42cf292bdf3ec61, the create_* functions were
not included in that commit. Today we have a handful of consumers that
use these create functions [1], so this patch rehomes them into lib.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=util.*%5C.create_
(port%7Cnetwork%7Csubnet)%5C(&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I2c0e4ef03425ba0bb2651ae3e68d6c8cde7b8f90

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: API 4.0 incompatibilities

4.0 folder paths begin with a /. Also add a check that the user formatted
the folder path correctly.

Change-Id: I9bdc17c3f0daab97c33908bf3b96fbce963aa9f2
Closes-Bug: #1719428

commit_message:
Fix api-ref for project tag create

Keystone currently returns a 201 with no body when creating a single
project tag by calling /v3/projects/{id}/tags/{value}, however the
current api documentation states that an array of tags is returned.

This is inconsistent with the current implementation which matches the
api-wg spec[0] for tags.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#addressing-individual-tags

Closes-Bug: #1756140

Change-Id: Ia15be1c79a6e8718b3613a16383ce0f5af839013

commit_message:
Update existing container_networks

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/494515
- https://review.openstack.org/553726

We don't update an existing container_network so once you have settings
set, they will not be changed, even if you change settings.

This patch ensures that if the existing container_network does not match
the current provider_network, it will get updated.

Closes-Bug: 1678165
Related-Bug: 1756091
Change-Id: Ia6d91bd6aabf0f9584a83641d5bd990d3f9e404f

test_update_cgroup_add_vol/remove_vol tests were completely broken
as add/remove_vol operation is not a part of cgroup_update.
These tests are fixed to pass tests after mock migration.
I don't know why they passes before.

test_create_cgroup_from_snapshot* in CG snapshot tests was also
broken (redirect destination and method signature were wrong).
They are fixed as well though I am not sure why they passed.

commit_message:
Convert project tests into mock: cgroups/cg_snapshots

test_update_cgroup_add_vol/remove_vol tests were completely broken
as add/remove_vol operation is not a part of cgroup_update.
These tests are fixed to pass tests after mock migration.
I don't know why they passes before.

test_create_cgroup_from_snapshot* in CG snapshot tests was also
broken (redirect destination and method signature were wrong).
They are fixed as well though I am not sure why they passed.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I8fe53390da2f7c35a31e339306e7d1394bb36218

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 17:36:11.000000000', 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
"}, {'created': '2018-03-20 17:21:27.000000000', 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
(cherry picked from commit a5ef4eadd1b7ab056e5bb16dc2a1284226871903)
"}]
commit_message:
Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
(cherry picked from commit a5ef4eadd1b7ab056e5bb16dc2a1284226871903)

commit_message:
Use defined version instead of service.version parameter

When api_version contains a version that begins with 'v',
We should use the defined version parameters.

Change-Id: I6be932088b4e622efafb2ee83b87cd929b2525d2
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-statsd project

Create an ansible role to be used by windmill for the purpose of
managing statsd. We won't be publishing to pypi or using official
documentation.

Change-Id: I81da138666ef3a5cb35cadae95f0c2feb5ba92fc
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Only try to stop services that exist

Test for the presence of services before trying to stop them.
Avoids a delay during initial deploy.

Change-Id: Id3ccba83a402074af77b62f67754a834d6f765b7
(cherry picked from commit 966b08123c4b350eb5a47e0ac301d2f89f85cd74)

commit_message:
Remove translation of log messages

* Removed all log translation.
* Always lazy-load logging.
* Fixed broken log lines and updated tests.

Logs should no longer be translated (starting with Pike)[1].

Also, according to OpenStack Guideline[2], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/thread.html#113365
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 20:10:38.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: add a note in DELETE /os-services about deleting computes

As seen in I2717274bb1bd370870acbf58c03dc59cee30cc5e, if an
operator deletes a nova-compute service via the API but fails
to stop the actual nova-compute process, the API will delete the
services table and compute_nodes table records, but the nova-compute
process will hit the 'update_available_resource' periodic task and
re-create the compute node record, which at that point is orphaned
since it does not have an associated nova-compute service.

Restarting the nova-compute service _should_ recreate the service
table record for that host and then the user could delete attempt to
delete the service and compute node record again via this API, but
it's better to not have to find this out the hard way.

So this change adds a simple reminder that the nova-compute process
on the host should be stopped before deleting the compute service.

Change-Id: I68f2074814c3ae890888a5c75fd2870bb99f0e08
Related-Bug: #1646255

commit_message:
api-ref: add a note in DELETE /os-services about deleting computes

As seen in I2717274bb1bd370870acbf58c03dc59cee30cc5e, if an
operator deletes a nova-compute service via the API but fails
to stop the actual nova-compute process, the API will delete the
services table and compute_nodes table records, but the nova-compute
process will hit the 'update_available_resource' periodic task and
re-create the compute node record, which at that point is orphaned
since it does not have an associated nova-compute service.

Restarting the nova-compute service _should_ recreate the service
table record for that host and then the user could attempt to
delete the service and compute node record again via this API, but
it's better to not have to find this out the hard way.

So this change adds a simple reminder that the nova-compute process
on the host should be stopped before deleting the compute service.

While in here, the link to the install guide about the various
compute services is also fixed.

Change-Id: I68f2074814c3ae890888a5c75fd2870bb99f0e08
Related-Bug: #1646255

commit_message:
Ensure cinder-ceph installs its prerequisites

The charm has been assuming that the principle charm will install
the packages this charm needs to run. This is not always the case
so the change forces the charm to install what it needs.

Change-Id: I1a394bd9f0a008a403d36ba5d7332b7fb5659006
Closes-Bug: #1754007

commit_message:
DNM: This makes keystoneclient.session.Session explode

This will show if anyone in the gate is using keystoneclient session
instead of keystoneauth (as expected)

commit_message:
Support --purge in Nova cleanup crons.

This patch adds the --purge parameter from
'nova-manage db' when executing the cleanup
tasks.

It will add the --purge parameter to the
archive_deleted_rows cron and will add an additional
cron to exclusively purge the shadow tables.

This feature is relevant due to the fact that we
were not purging the databases before running
upgrades, leading to the increase of the DB sizes.

Change-Id: I4ac0c9bd30463c546b141326b1293c78f845cf81

messages:
[{'account_id': 27983, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:54:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:59:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This all looks good to me.  I'm sorry that the debian and rpm changelogs have my name on, even though you did the work, Casey, but I think that's a consequence of hardcoding in our build scripts."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Avoid putting rgw conf on ALL hosts

To avoid adding unnecessary RGW configuration to hosts that don't
require it we should separate out the rgw_overrides to only apply to
ceph.conf on RGW hosts.

Additionally, the radosgw_dns_name var is no longer used by ceph-ansible
or OSA in any way, so this has been cleaned up and removed.

Change-Id: I243e742da3bf7d1e452998f257f7d0804e13237b

[{'created': '2018-03-16 10:20:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

By removing the " " this is resolved.

Change-Id: I1351fddbdfd09f0a1a5eeef4afb44679bd39cd63
(cherry picked from commit 07817a412c6473a812c9c0a7014e45eba5c62a30)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

By removing the " " this is resolved.

Change-Id: I1351fddbdfd09f0a1a5eeef4afb44679bd39cd63
(cherry picked from commit 07817a412c6473a812c9c0a7014e45eba5c62a30)

commit_message:
Fix Spark EDP job failed in vanilla 2.8.2

Vanilla should specify corresponded hadoop-openstack package
according to plugin version in spark configuration.

In Vanilla 2.8.2, there is an error that hadoop-openstack
version was specified to 2.7.1. This causes spark job failed
in vanilla 2.8.2 because of "No such file".

Change-Id: I5b54d69def7b457715ed60da3663a0153fe94be8
(cherry picked from commit 779cade38548687b63ca3fa84c1ff58598e64768)

commit_message:
Fix local test fails with pypy

tox: ERROR: pypy: InterpreterNotFound: pypy

Maybe we need to remove pypy-constraints from envlist in tox.ini
because there is no effect to review.

Change-Id: I1ff1cb103dcaad1396bc2bda487165feae6b0931

commit_message:
Fix create volume error from source volume

When creating a volume from a source volume, if the source volume's
volume_type_id is none, set the source volume id to the currently selected
volume type's id. This only applies to back-end hosts that are consistent.

Partial-Bug: #1589349

messages:
[{'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2017-12-26 20:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2017-12-26 20:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2017-12-27 03:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2017-12-27 04:10:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

At first glance this looks like exactly what we discussed. I'd like to have Doug weigh in to make sure this works in the way he's thinking."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-27 06:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks, looks good for the index pages with one typo -> -1.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2017-12-27 12:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-02 14:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

This is a good start toward what we need. It adds badges to the pages from docs built out of this repo, but doesn't directly address badges built from docs in *other* repos. To achieve that, we need to eventually:

1. Generate the badge content as a file that can be "included" somehow by the template as a page is rendered in the browser. For example, by writing to $series/badge.something.
2. Update the openstackdocstheme to "include" docs.o.o/$series/badge.something at the top of every page.

Including the file at page load time is necessary so we don't have to rebuild really old documentation just to mark the pages obsolete.

+1 for now pending some other opinions on the wording. If others are ok with the wording I'm happy to +2 and we can iterate on the other requirements.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-01-03 16:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

well in the past i did a similar work

here 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/475845/

basically we duplicated the work on openstackdocstheme

so we should proceed on same way ?

regards'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-03 18:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > well in the past i did a similar work
 > 
 > here
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/475845/
 > 
 > basically we duplicated the work on openstackdocstheme
 > 
 > so we should proceed on same way ?
 > 
 > regards

It isn't sufficient to duplicate the work in the theme this time, unfortunately. When a series moves into a state where it is no longer supported, we don't have a trigger to let us rebuild all of the affected documentation. We do have a way to update 1 badge on docs.o.o, though. So we need a way to have the theme include the badge from a fixed URL, and then we can replace the content at that URL.

I'm not familiar enough with the web technologies involved to know what would work best. We talked about SVG at one point, I think? Maybe there's a way to do it with CSS, too?"}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-01-04 12:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Many thanks for the patch! Some nits below.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-01-04 16:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

A fancy nice to have feature would be to offer the user a way to cancel or hide the deprecation badge, similarly to cookie banners on EU-based sites.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ok fixed wording and added a close button to hide the badge.
ihmo we need to get solution for 
"Update the openstackdocstheme to "include" docs.o.o/$series/badge.something at the top of every page."
on another patch

regards'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-02-02 18:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-02-02 18:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

ok i managed to create a $series/badge.html file that i think i could be include using an iframe on oo docs theme
thing is that i am looking at docstheme and i dont see any way to figure out the current accessed release in order to select the proper badge 
regards'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> ok i managed to create a $series/badge.html file that i think i
 > could be include using an iframe on oo docs theme
 > thing is that i am looking at docstheme and i dont see any way to
 > figure out the current accessed release in order to select the
 > proper badge
 > regards

Would [1], or some variant of same, be suitable?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491868/'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

> > ok i managed to create a $series/badge.html file that i think i
 > > could be include using an iframe on oo docs theme
 > > thing is that i am looking at docstheme and i dont see any way to
 > > figure out the current accessed release in order to select the
 > > proper badge
 > > regards
 > 
 > Would [1], or some variant of same, be suitable?
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491868/

Yes, that function can be used. We may need to do some extra work to ensure the value is in the html context so the theme can see it, though.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-03-07 13:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-03-07 13:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

ok i fixed the comments

regards'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-03-15 10:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Looks good, here, thanks! But still needs some improvement, please see my comments inline. :)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2018-03-15 19:55:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

These last two comments are very editorial/design decisions. Can I suggest we approve the patch as is, and then get a separate patch going for suggested CSS adjustments?  The original code for this came from openstack.org and the Foundation Design team. That doesn't mean you have to stick with it, but there is some precedent."}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

OK, I agree.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-03-20 16:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Merging this now.

Sebastian, can you please start a follow-up change?'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just to clarify, the additional changes would be based on the last comments made by Stephen and Chason. Thanks.'}]

commit_message:
Added deprecation badge

added a new fixed badge indicating the deprecation status of each
release

* obsolete - "No longer supported by the community. For the current release,
  CLICK HERE.", #ff0000
* EOL - "No longer supported by the community. For the current release,
  CLICK HERE.", #ff0000
* maintained - This has two states. The current release and recent releases.
** Current Release - "This is the current release.", #30739C
** Recent Release - "This is maintained, but NOT the current release. For
   the current release, CLICK HERE.", #eaeaea
* Current Release - "This is the current release.", #30739C
* Recent Release - "This is maintained, but NOT the current release. For
  the current release, CLICK HERE.", #eaeaea
* development - "This release is currently under development For the
  current release, CLICK HERE.", #eaeaea

Change-Id: I67a759440c2e99b33aa925c5e17c11a1b885ac82

commit_message:
Purge resolv.conf from the overcloud images

When building the images we should not be including any values in the
resolv.conf. This change adds the element to clear it for the
overcloud-full, hardened and realtime compute images.

Depends-On: If8c44137d120059b356675a074e3af23ea63a6f8
Change-Id: Ib2531e0a696915ab980aea5a65a425789938786c
Closes-Bug: #1749756
(cherry picked from commit e54f1a72843aa2b35a4ec273ff260c94ba05a456)

commit_message:
Pin puppet-collectd

puppet-collectd introduced a change which requires stdlib 4.25:
de0a96e86651 - (2018-03-17 00:12:21 +0100) feat: bump minimum puppetlabs/stdlib version to 4.25.0
c0c5ba9357ea - (2018-03-16 23:54:58 +0100) feat: use Stdlib::Fqdn type for package_keyserver

Let's pin the repo to the change which is already being used in RDO at
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/master/rdo.yml#L1467

(aka 93c8d0bd32bb5610652f30e785ba6644fc82a8b6 "Merge pull request #751 from bastelfreak/test")

Closes-Bug: #1756890
Change-Id: I197e8036a4f5c790a833d037d03ba6822f5488eb
(cherry picked from commit 489d5502dad7f936fadb90a6ff97b98465414de5)

commit_message:
Add floating ip connectivity check to common dir and use it for FFU

This change adds the floating IP connectivity check scripts to the
common directory and adjusts existing update and upgrade to use the
new location. In addition it runs the connectivity check scripts
before and after the FFU overcloud upgrade stages.

Change-Id: I8c2fe2ad88c8388a673a4b6c415f6a76bebfd72d
(cherry picked from commit db75499539c4ccf72c4a9524fe2c3651d879a7b1)

commit_message:
FFU: Introduce Aodh fast-forward-upgrade tasks

this upgrades the aodh services from N -> Q

bp fast-forward-upgrades

commit_message:
Switch IPDevice.exists() method to use pyroute2

Check if network device exists is now done by checking
interface index with pyroute2 interface instead of checking
if MAC address for device is set.

Change-Id: I2d5b95ec109fb19fc2a46c1017959f74011b9a22
Related-Bug: #1492714

subject: Add support for installing novnc and spice-html5
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-01 23:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2017-12-04 20:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we should make this optional to allow one of three options:
1) dont install anything (ie no proxy, or serialproxy in use)
2) install novnc (the default?)
3) install spice-html5'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-04 20:13:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Im conflicted. These files add so little in size that its hard to say we shouldn't include them.

For one, we absoultely should include at least novnc files by default. I would say also spice except spice as the websockify dep, and that makes me think spice should be optional.

Since the serialproxy does replace novnc/spice, a case could be made for optional, but how do we make it optional and default to on without yet another Dockerfile env var thats specific to Nova?"}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2017-12-11 18:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Without this sort of change being available, it needs to be documented. The last thing I want is to have every user who tries to run these containers running all over search engines to figure out why "feature <x> doesn't work with Loci containers", then coming up with the same solution on their own.

It might even be a set of additional code that takes care of how to pull dependencies like this in. Thinking aloud.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-11 20:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add support for installing novnc and spice-html5

Previously, these items would have needed to be bind-mounted in so the
console services could properly render these pages and provide the
console service.

Change-Id: I7fc1b9fd47da5a2a524237aa9b8e626dbc7d6a09

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Yup,  looks good.

This reminds me of a conversation that mriedem, jaypipes and I had last week about whether there was ever a valid use case when a compute node would want to _not_ report (some of the) cpu features that it has. I thought there might be (say you have specialized hardware that right now you don't want to use in a specialized way), but wasn't really sure. Matt felt that it was best to report everything and then constrain things by aggregates."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-03-12 21:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(5 comments)

a few nits but nothing blocking'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-12 22:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:22:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I don't understand this spec.  Exposing CPU features out of the virt driver is part and parcel of implementing update_provider_tree/get_traits.  Is this spec just saying we're gonna do that for libvirt?

On that note, I got a little excited when I saw the 'libvirt' section, because I then expected to see sections for all the other drivers.  Not so.  So perhaps this bp/spec should have had 'libvirt' in its name."}]

commit_message:
Add undercloud's CA certificate before deployment

As part of making the undercloud use TLS by default, this sets the
undercloud's CA certificate to be deployed to the overcloud nodes
as part of the depoy workflow. This workflow was used because it
assures us that it's undercloud specific (which might have a different
CA certificate).

Change-Id: I55caee4fc3e04362f8a6f7935d6ad0ea72527b70

commit_message:
Run specific jobs with quickstart.sh

To continue to gate quickstart.sh in CI we need to run
a few jobs with quickstart.sh.
Set containers multinode and fs001 jobs to run with quickstart.sh

Change-Id: I6a1f4e13468a4bab1589d2b9e2904c0a21599b8c

subject: Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth
messages:
[{'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-14 06:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:56:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Unfortunately, Pike is open only for critical an security issues now. But it's still a good candidate to be backported to Queens"}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-14 08:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-14 08:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:01:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Although Angular errors occur, login page works without this fix in default settings.
So this issue may not seem critical. 
But I don't have WEBSSO environment, so I could not reproduce original bug report.
I'd like to wait for comment by Gloria who reported this issue whether this issue is critical or not."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-14 15:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-14 18:09:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It is odd...I remember one of my tries was put the the ng details in the urls.py and was having probolems. With loading exception, the hz-login-finder in the login page won't work correctly for WEBSSO which is more of for enterprise env.  I will test it and let you know."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-14 18:57:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Shu there is something wrong...I tried your patch, your patch shows the login page with no exception now...however, if I put the right user/pass, then it clear the login page and no errors no dashboard. I did rm -rf .tox, rm -rf static, find . -name '*.pyc' -delete  a couple of times...even reboot the system...I can see the horizon runserver console, all seem to loaded correctly and login correctly, but no dashboard presented. If I switch to stable/pike, it has the exceptions but I can login and see the dashboard."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-14 19:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If this is not the right fix and causes some other problems, we need to think reverting the previous cherry pick in stable/pike since it is regression. If this is the right fix, I think it needs to be cherry picked to stable/pike to fix the regression caused by previous cherry pick.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-14 20:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Shu and @Ivan, after a couple of round of testing...I think this might not be a good idea to backported to stable/pike. Noticed the following is different 

in master or this patch:

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^$', views.splash, name='splash'),
    url(r'^api/', include(rest.urls)),
    url(r'^header/', views.ExtensibleHeaderView.as_view()),
    url(r'', horizon.base._wrapped_include(horizon.urls)),
]

in stable/pike

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^$', views.splash, name='splash'),
    url(r'^api/', include(rest.urls)),
    url(r'', include(horizon.urls)),
]

those extra stuffs like header or wrapped_include in master could cause some other issues in pike

I applied ng view injection into pike code...it seems to be fine. 

I think since we can not cherry pick whatever the changes in this fix, we should revert the last cherry pick regarding ngdetail in pike since it causes regression."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-14 21:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Shu Muto and @Ivan, to clarify my last comments which I found it confusing. What I tried to say is reverting the change in base.py and applying the portion in urls.py seems to work on pike.  However tried this patch which is based on master, I am not able to load dashboard anymore even I see login successful and dashboard loaded messages in the runserver window. My take is to revert the change which causes regression on pike. Again, this is my take, it might not be valid.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-15 01:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Gloria, thank you very much for clarifying the issue on stable/pike. Unfortunately, cherry-picked patch into stable/pike for refreshing ngdetails seems to cause critical problem. I agree with revert it from stable/pike. Could you test this patch for master branch?'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Shu Muto, I tested this patch on master, but got a problem rendering dashboard. After a successful login, dashboard doesn't replace the login page. No errors no exceptions, runserver terminal showed all loaded.  I tried a couple of times with clean scrub and even reboot my system, no luck."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-16 00:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> After a successful login, dashboard doesn't replace the login page.

@Gloria, let me ask your environment.  When you said the above, are you using WEBSSO env or a normal no-WEBSSO env? I followed the comments but I cannot understand what environment is assumed.

In my local testing with no-WEBSSO env, it works well and also addresses bug 1753557 too."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-16 00:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Gloria, do you have any pointer and/or instructions on how we can setup websso env? Hopefully instruction for devstack env would be nice. two devstack is okay for me. I think most horizon developers do not know how we can test websso. This makes debugging hard and websso bugs tend to take time to land.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-16 00:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-17 00:28:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Akihiro I don't have WEBSSO env myself. QA did, but current it is not available, need setup again. I don't have that in my dev environment. I tried the change on local horizon.  First I tried with  git review -d 552789, I have problems as I described. Then I switched to stable/pike, and updated the code manually , it seems to be ok."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-17 00:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Akihiro I will ask QA about how to set up WEBSSO, they seem to have some scripts to run. I will find out and let you know.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-17 09:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Gloria, thanks for sharing the current situation. It would be nice if you can get more information.

BTW, Could you vote +1/-1 based on your test result?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-17 09:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-17 09:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-17 09:45:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I proposed cherry-pick patches to pike and queens to make testing easier.

Queens: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553969/
Pike: https://review.openstack.org/553970/'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-18 08:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-19 08:49:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I'll keep +A until Gloria confirms that issue is fixed"}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-03-19 12:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Ivan and @Motoki, will try again.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:16:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

@Ivan and @Motoki, I tested the change,  I still have the same issue as last week that the dashboard doesn't get rendered even with successful login. I tried without the change on master, it has the same issue, so I believe the change doesn't cause the problem i have on master. I manually applied the changes to pike on our QA system, the login exception is gone and detail refresh has no 404. I am ok to merge this change."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-20 00:16:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1

Let's merge this."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Akihiro or @Ivan, will this be cherry picked to pike, or will not? Please let me know your plan.'}]

commit_message:
Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth

Angular errors on login page are caused by loading ngdetails view.
Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

Change-Id: Ib039417b4e666c2341f17ac05fd7723bc758816c
Closes-Bug: #1754133
Closes-Bug: #1753557

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary indents

The theme of ironic specs was changed just before the BIOS
configuration spec of was approved. Due to this change, this spec looks
slightly ugly. This patch removes unnecessary indents to make it
comfortable to read this spec during code review.

Change-Id: Ia14c054e3db0fa973640ddb44ee7cca9db611b8f

commit_message:
Remove outdated tools and files

Those tools have been mostly removed from the repositories and
they do not add much to what can be done with few commands
(direct call of virtualenv, or use of tox for various test runners).
MANIFEST.in is not needed anymore apparently too, thanks
to changes in pbr (thanks Jeremy Freudberg for noticing this).

Change-Id: I4cfb47a758f39f2de5ebd77fc88124335ded4aa3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 16:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'Rework Bare Metal service overview in the install guide

Currently we have a detailed explanation of how ironic is architected,
but it resides in the user guide for some reason. This change moves
relevant bits to the install guide to the existing "Bare Metal service
overview" section. The text is cleaned up (e.g. s/ironic/Bare Metal/)
and ordered to simplify reading. A link to ironic-ui is added.

The user guide still contains the bits that are helpful for users
to understand the bare metal deployment process.

Change-Id: I17e38454f7893c00b71ac29328bd80d3978ed1f4
'}]
commit_message:
Rework Bare Metal service overview in the install guide

Currently we have a detailed explanation of how ironic is architected,
but it resides in the user guide for some reason. This change moves
relevant bits to the install guide to the existing "Bare Metal service
overview" section. The text is cleaned up (e.g. s/ironic/Bare Metal/)
and ordered to simplify reading. A link to ironic-ui is added.

The user guide still contains the bits that are helpful for users
to understand the bare metal deployment process.

Change-Id: I17e38454f7893c00b71ac29328bd80d3978ed1f4

commit_message:
Add plugin xstatic modules support

This patch allows Horizon to accept additional xstatic modules
 in plugin dashboards. Related static files would be collected
 and included in every page.

Change-Id: Ie49a522b28aaf6e028c5b218968d68189dd7eef1
Closes-Bug: #1755339

commit_message:
test_failure_to_write fails with root user

The test test_failure_to_write will fail with root.

This patch add a mock to prevent path creation, makes the test
fits for root and non-root user.

Change-Id: I7e55c4070c41927f05c2cfdd284c8d542f1d8906
Closes-Bug: #1693129

commit_message:
WIP! sphinxext: Move some functions into directive class scope

We're going to need access to some instance attributes. It's easier to
move all this into class scope rather than pass everything around as
parameters.

messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-16 17:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nFound a better way'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 17:30:34.000000000', 'message': 'WIP! sphinxext: Parse each opt group independently

At present, badly formatted rST in 'Opt.help' attributes will result in
the following, rather unhelpful warning message:

  <oslo_config.sphinxext>:1:Unexpected indentation.

This is clearly useless and we want to provide more information.
The way to do this is to include the rST we generated on the 'source'
attribute of a 'ViewList' object, allowing docutils reporters to link an
error to a particualar "source" line. However, for something like nova,
the entire source is more than 10,000 lines long, making this output
extremely hard to parse.

Resolve this by parsing each option separately. This ensure our error
messages are localized to the offending option.

Change-Id: I182f0d19e979b985edf0aa358b1b93c711ce063d
'}, {'created': '2018-03-20 15:46:07.000000000', 'message': 'WIP! sphinxext: Parse each opt group independently

At present, badly formatted rST in 'Opt.help' attributes will result in
the following, rather unhelpful warning message:

  <oslo_config.sphinxext>:1:Unexpected indentation.

This is clearly useless and we want to provide more information.
The way to do this is to include the rST we generated on the 'source'
attribute of a 'ViewList' object, allowing docutils reporters to link an
error to a particualar "source" line. However, for something like nova,
the entire source is more than 10,000 lines long, making this output
extremely hard to parse.

Resolve this by parsing each option separately. This ensure our error
messages are localized to the offending option.

Change-Id: I182f0d19e979b985edf0aa358b1b93c711ce063d
'}]
commit_message:
WIP! sphinxext: Parse each opt group independently

At present, badly formatted rST in 'Opt.help' attributes will result in
the following, rather unhelpful warning message:

  <oslo_config.sphinxext>:1:Unexpected indentation.

This is clearly useless and we want to provide more information.
The way to do this is to include the rST we generated on the 'source'
attribute of a 'ViewList' object, allowing docutils reporters to link an
error to a particualar "source" line. However, for something like nova,
the entire source is more than 10,000 lines long, making this output
extremely hard to parse.

Resolve this by parsing each option separately. This ensure our error
messages are localized to the offending option.

Change-Id: I182f0d19e979b985edf0aa358b1b93c711ce063d

commit_message:
functions-common: Don't reguess Python versions

We have already established the correct version of Python to use during
installation, either automatically or through user-provided information
(USE_PYTHON3, PYTHON3_VERSION). Don't do it again.

Change-Id: I7bdf2be9a885994bf2c437dd104048a1ff2f6666
Closes-Bug: #1744096

commit_message:
Fix 'block_store' aliases define error

This patch fix volume aliases error, the service type use
'block-storage', but aliases define use 'block_storage'.
So, Can't use 'block_store' finish list volumes.

Change-Id: I003f7064c13dc907833c2a1e66cc11a823d47be6
Closes-Bug: #1757032

Importing pip in code is apparently not supported, but the ryu
library is using it internally. Version 4.18 included a change

appear to not call from any OpenStack code. Bumping u-c to pick

commit_message:
Bump ryu to 4.18 to avoid pip import issues

Importing pip in code is apparently not supported, but the ryu
library is using it internally. Version 4.18 included a change
to only import pip where needed in a specific method that we
appear to not call from any OpenStack code. Bumping u-c to pick
up this change and test with affected projects.

Pip issue with more details:
https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/5081

Change-Id: Ia358176cd9d590ac153fcf6bd9da34e2425ff3ee
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/554338

commit_message:
Add tempest test for the 'nets' parameter

This patch will add the tempest test for the 'nets' parameter.
The test pre-creates a neutron port and run a container with
the pre-created neutron port. This test verifies the Zun container
will work with an existing neutron port.

Closes-bug: #1753270

Change-Id: Ie00deb46b879e7625ec83141715d9383ce961469

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 10:51:13.000000000', 'message': 'Stop inventory constantly giving containers new IP

See bug for further details, this was affecting pike after applying
the backported patch.

As the bug mentions, some containers were constantly given new IPs,
even with no changes to user_variables yml files or
openstack_user_config.yml file.

Further to the bug, I think that the code in master/patch will
cause containers to receive new IPs when network settings are
changed (bridge, mtu, type) rather than just updating that setting.

Change-Id: I0a757e9f503d3f604b2ba2c3409b4a4507d5edff
Closes-Bug: 1756091
(cherry picked from commit b72b3add9f20cc9a64a858d5ab70c3d90846c460)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop inventory constantly giving containers new IP

See bug for further details, this was affecting pike after applying
the backported patch.

As the bug mentions, some containers were constantly given new IPs,
even with no changes to user_variables yml files or
openstack_user_config.yml file.

Further to the bug, I think that the code in master/patch will
cause containers to receive new IPs when network settings are
changed (bridge, mtu, type) rather than just updating that setting.

Change-Id: I0a757e9f503d3f604b2ba2c3409b4a4507d5edff
Closes-Bug: 1756091
(cherry picked from commit b72b3add9f20cc9a64a858d5ab70c3d90846c460)

[{'created': '2018-03-20 15:56:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add method repr() to NovaException

Add method repr() to NovaException so that kwargs are not
removed when the exception is serialized.

The change to return repr(Exception) instead of serializing
the individual variables and arguments of the exception is
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8.

Change-Id: I8b95a96e51e8cc11c1348298c72490bc674a958f
'}]
commit_message:
Add method repr() to NovaException

Add method repr() to NovaException so that kwargs are not
removed when the exception is serialized.

The change to return repr(Exception) instead of serializing
the individual variables and arguments of the exception is
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8.

Change-Id: I8b95a96e51e8cc11c1348298c72490bc674a958f

[{'created': '2018-03-20 09:36:12.000000000', 'message': 'Adding driver to mysql connection URL

With current URL [1], default driver will be used.
In order to ensure the compatibility, it is better to include the exact driver [2].

[1] connection = mysql://
[2] connection = mysql+pymysql://

Change-Id: I0a849e4f41f027de806f0969fc03ce4a2dcc8ffa
'}]
commit_message:
Adding driver to mysql connection URL

With current URL [1], default driver will be used.
In order to ensure the compatibility, it is better to include the exact driver [2].

[1] connection = mysql://
[2] connection = mysql+pymysql://

Change-Id: I0a849e4f41f027de806f0969fc03ce4a2dcc8ffa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 13:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add auto_shard option to enable or disable leader behaviour

Add auto_shard option to container-sharder section of container server
config.

When auto_shard is true the sharder daemon will adopt leader behaviour
as before, i.e.  the daemon is the leader for the node index 0 replica
of a container.

When auto_shard is false (the default) the sharder daemon never adopts
leader behaviour.

Change-Id: I28cce3562a683c36ff39e3d99b8c48eaff70f34d
'}]
commit_message:
Add auto_shard option to enable or disable leader behaviour

Add auto_shard option to container-sharder section of container server
config.

When auto_shard is true the sharder daemon will adopt leader behaviour
as before, i.e.  the daemon is the leader for the node index 0 replica
of a container.

When auto_shard is false (the default) the sharder daemon never adopts
leader behaviour.

Change-Id: I28cce3562a683c36ff39e3d99b8c48eaff70f34d

subject: Rename tempest plugin folder
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-19 13:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-19 14:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-19 14:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:11:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'd prefer this module to be moved to a new repo. Several top-level packages are quite a pain for packagers."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-20 07:38:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dmitry, there's one argument to make against moving to an extra repo:

all the tests present currently are meaningful exclusively for single-node DevStack with single ovs_linux 'switch' managed by n-g-s, and the tests _must_ run on the same DevStack node.

Moving in a separate repo would make a false impression that the tests can be used to verify n-g-s as all the other tempest tests are designed, which is to be run from outside of the cloud, and on every OpenStack cloud.

We should in fact rather consider these tests as just functional tests that are written using the tempest test framework."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-20 07:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

may be we should instead move them to the tests/functional folder and just run them from there, w/o exporting the tempest plugin at all.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:28:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> may be we should instead move them to the tests/functional folder and just run them from there, w/o exporting the tempest plugin at all.

++ let's do it. the problem right now is that we do advertise the tempest plugin, so it will be run with --all-plugins, I suspect"}]

commit_message:
Rename tempest plugin folder

the current name 'tempest_plugin' is too generic and can
shadow/be shadowed by other tempest modules and plugins.

Let's use a more specific name.

Change-Id: Ib28036e9570a830a50169662a272617e0815da7f

commit_message:
Switch documentation to hardware types

The devstack example configuration is synchronized with
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/dev-quickstart.html

Also remove setting IRONIC_VM_LOGS_DIR from the example local.conf,
as it does not work, at least not on CentOS.

Change-Id: Ife51165742a8b762e84d5ac7ad807480669bfedb

[{'created': '2018-03-09 10:22:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove registry special casing which no longer has any effect

This was only needed when we need to special-case SwiftStorage, but
since we now have the resource names match the role name [1], having
the special casing will result in the same resource registry being
generated as when not having it.

[1] see change I96fd27bdad5d417f23550ecc3387d81fd3c5418a

Change-Id: I367081a8aa32178f1c8cf07bae2db3d0c0bc1258
'}]
commit_message:
Remove registry special casing which no longer has any effect

This was only needed when we need to special-case SwiftStorage, but
since we now have the resource names match the role name [1], having
the special casing will result in the same resource registry being
generated as when not having it.

[1] see change I96fd27bdad5d417f23550ecc3387d81fd3c5418a

Change-Id: I367081a8aa32178f1c8cf07bae2db3d0c0bc1258

[{'created': '2018-03-07 11:19:06.000000000', 'message': 'Do not record host identification for reproducer ssh commands.

As we're using cloud instance the probability to get the same ip with
changed ssh keys is high.  Avoid "WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION
HAS CHANGED!" failure by making sure that we don't record the ssh key
locally.

Change-Id: I4f8955e387387606b76f1dbb91cbed6b94b47b15

commit_message:
Do not record host identification for reproducer ssh commands.

As we're using cloud instance the probability to get the same ip with
changed ssh keys is high.  Avoid "WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION
HAS CHANGED!" failure by making sure that we don't record the ssh key
locally.

Change-Id: I4f8955e387387606b76f1dbb91cbed6b94b47b15

commit_message:
Improve messages on node state transitions

First, the state is called 'manageable', not 'managed'. Second,
the current messages do not provide enough context to be valuable.
This change modifies them to include nodes count and uses more
precise wording.

Change-Id: Ia1226123271408e959d7aa2049140c06f7ba5e87

subject: Charm spec for openstack+ovn under specs/queens/backlog.
messages:
[{'account_id': 26805, 'date': '2018-03-11 18:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-11 18:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-03-12 09:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

Thanks for this spec.

Lots of inline comments; there is also some trailing space in the spec - please remove!

Cheers

James'}, {'account_id': 26805, 'date': '2018-03-12 18:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-03-16 13:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Looking better - two minor comments only.'}, {'account_id': 26805, 'date': '2018-03-19 12:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26805, 'date': '2018-03-19 12:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Improve healthchecks

To help deployers with openstack ansible, we add these playbooks
on the deploy guide path. It makes it easier for everyone
to know the cause for failures: the common one would be caught
and documented.

Change-Id: Ia7cb6327dc887c859404930e238bd5462e2bbc72
(cherry picked from commit 17c1439ccb82ec9ecdbe6cac5565233f92df100b)

commit_message:
Add network id to pools keys

This is one of the first steps needed to have pools support when
pods can be allocated on different networks. Otherwise, a common
pool could serve pods on different networks if they share
hostIP/hostname, project_id and security groups.

Closes-Bug: 1752600
Change-Id: If9c8e898ec711576afc125f0d3af50d1bd2f3eff
(cherry picked from commit bc7e90008299a856f951e895c700362b74fb3d67)

Testing...

commit_message:
Define ironic_db_password default

It seems we're encountering a weird variable expansing
a weird variable expansion issue on FC 27 with ansible.

Defining a default should at least unblock infra efforts
and we can figure it out later.

Change-Id: If9caf26a8ef5b37cf3db718054a2522f750f924b

Enable xenial/queens amulet tests

using new amulet charmhelpers in functional tests.

Enable xenial/queens amulet test as part of extended tests.

commit_message:
Fix Spark EDP job failed in vanilla 2.8.2

Vanilla should specify corresponded hadoop-openstack package
according to plugin version in spark configuration.

In Vanilla 2.8.2, there is an error that hadoop-openstack
version was specified to 2.7.1. This causes spark job failed
in vanilla 2.8.2 because of "No such file".

Change-Id: I5b54d69def7b457715ed60da3663a0153fe94be8

subject: Make the 'Could not find data item hacluster_pwd' error a bit clearer
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 18:13:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make the 'Could not find data item hacluster_pwd' error a bit clearer

If you deploy a role with a pacemaker-managed service (galera, rabbit, redis,
etc) but forgot to add the ::tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker
there will be a rather unintuitive error:
  puppet apply --debug --verbose --detailed-exitcodes --summarize --color=false --modulepath
    /etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/module --tags
    file,file_line,concat,augeas,pacemaker::resource::bundle,pacemaker::property,pacemaker::resource::ocf,pacemaker::constraint::order,pacemaker::constraint::colocation
    -e 'include ::tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker;include ::tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::redis_bundle'",
  Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function
  Call, Could not find data item hacluster_pwd in any Hiera data file and no default supplied at
  /etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp:127:24 on node role-2.localdomain

Let's make it a bit clearer. Long-term we want to look at a validation
that covers this.

Change-Id: Iffb6e76cdd0286ef10ada57c70ce31971e42c84f
'}]
commit_message:
Make the 'Could not find data item hacluster_pwd' error a bit clearer

If you deploy a role with a pacemaker-managed service (galera, rabbit, redis,
etc) but forgot to add the ::tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker
there will be a rather unintuitive error:
  puppet apply --debug --verbose --detailed-exitcodes --summarize --color=false --modulepath
    /etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/module --tags
    file,file_line,concat,augeas,pacemaker::resource::bundle,pacemaker::property,pacemaker::resource::ocf,pacemaker::constraint::order,pacemaker::constraint::colocation
    -e 'include ::tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker;include ::tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::redis_bundle'",
  Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function
  Call, Could not find data item hacluster_pwd in any Hiera data file and no default supplied at
  /etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp:127:24 on node role-2.localdomain

Let's make it a bit clearer. Long-term we want to look at a validation
that covers this.

Change-Id: Iffb6e76cdd0286ef10ada57c70ce31971e42c84f

commit_message:
Fix tap device disappear after node restart

When use driver_handles_share_servers driver, the tap device will
down and the tap device  mac address is changed after restart the
node, that will caused manila can not manage share that created
by this service.
This path fix this issue. When restart manila-share service,
call setup_connectivity_with_service_instances() to create host port
and check the the mac address.

Change-Id: Ibcdd4f58f15a53c69d35db06bc42283859349758
Closes-Bug:#1688155

subject: Bug fix: filter topology by project_id also when there is a query
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 12:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'Bug fix: filter topology by project_id also when there is a query

Previously, if vitrage topology show was called with a filter parameter,
the project_id was not added to the query so the returned topology
included resources of other projects as well.

Example:
vitrage topology show --filter "{ \"==\" : {\"vitrage_type\" : \"nova.instance\"} }"

Returned instances of other projects.

Change-Id: I97011c0dd3e0984b638a51f6ec9bddf5325d32e7
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: filter topology by project_id also when there is a query

Previously, if vitrage topology show was called with a filter parameter,
the project_id was not added to the query so the returned topology
included resources of other projects as well.

Example:
vitrage topology show --filter "{ \"==\" : {\"vitrage_type\" : \"nova.instance\"} }"

Returned instances of other projects.

Change-Id: I97011c0dd3e0984b638a51f6ec9bddf5325d32e7
